video_name: Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q
video_trans:
00:00:21.325 --> 00:00:25.154
To release it make sure your
foot is on the brake, and
00:00:25.154 --> 00:00:28.647
the ignition is on,
then push the switch down.

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: How do you know that the cup holders are secure?

can be adjusted in many ways to give

Let me explain.
00:00:10.850 --> 00:00:13.300
The front seats in your car
can be adjusted manually or
00:00:13.300 --> 00:00:16.490

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:45.740 --> 00:00:49.720
Also new to SYNC 3 is simplified
voice commands, that make controlling
00:00:49.720 --> 00:00:53.700
certain features quick and easy without
having to go through multiple steps.
00:00:53.700 --> 00:00:56.390
For instance,
if you're listening to the radio and
00:00:56.390 --> 00:01:00.070
want to change to listening to your
media device, use the voice button and
00:01:00.070 --> 00:01:03.320
say, play song I am alive, for example.
00:01:03.320 --> 00:01:04.590
It's that easy.

video_name: Twin-Panel Moonroof _ Ford How-To _ Ford-VVTFXgQAMeE
video_trans:

To open the moonroof partway,
press the button lightly and
00:00:48.915 --> 00:00:51.115
release it wherever you want it to stop.
00:00:51.115 --> 00:00:55.894
If you just want to vent the roof with the
sunshade open, find the button marked with
00:00:55.894 --> 00:00:59.459
the car icon and an open roof,
then press it firmly and let go.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.714
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.714 --> 00:00:10.584
You may be interested to know,
as part of an effort to provide our
00:00:10.584 --> 00:00:13.938
customers with more information about
what happens with their vehicles,
00:00:13.938 --> 00:00:17.030
we've improved the vehicle
health report feature.
00:00:17.030 --> 00:00:20.800
As a matter of fact, in addition to being
able to view a vehicle health report
00:00:20.800 --> 00:00:22.290
on the Ford Owner's Site,
00:00:22.290 --> 00:00:25.560
you can also have certain information
about your vehicle sent directly to your
00:00:25.560 --> 00:00:29.590
personal email address to help
resolve certain issues that may arise.
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:30.900
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg1.mp4

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.359 --> 00:00:03.800
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.800 --> 00:00:07.792
Your transit's fuel door is conveniently
located inside the driver's door for
00:00:07.792 --> 00:00:09.550
quick and easy fill ups.
00:00:09.550 --> 00:00:13.380
To open the fuel filler door,
the driver's door must be open.
00:00:13.380 --> 00:00:16.990
Once it is, place your finger under
the filler door tab and pull.
00:00:16.990 --> 00:00:19.770
You'll notice it has the Easy Fuel
capless fuel filler, so
00:00:19.770 --> 00:00:21.870
there's no cap to twist off.
00:00:21.870 --> 00:00:23.970
Just insert the fuel
pump nozzle all they way,
00:00:23.970 --> 00:00:28.040
making sure it passes through both
spring-loaded flaps, then fill up.
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:31.550
Once it's stopped filling, wait about
ten seconds before removing the nozzle,
00:00:31.550 --> 00:00:34.020
to allow any residual to drain out.
00:00:34.020 --> 00:00:36.690
Remove the nozzle and close the fuel door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg1.mp4
question: Where is the fuel door located?

video_name: Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.259
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.259 --> 00:00:07.200
Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876
your vehicle to monitor and
provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350
a trailer that you're towing
are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850
Let me explain.
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0_seg1.mp4
question: What does the Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System do?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the Trailer Brake Control located?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:36.640 --> 00:00:39.860
Aid mode uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer your vehicle
00:00:39.860 --> 00:00:41.220
towards your lane.
00:00:41.220 --> 00:00:43.560
You'll actually feel
the wheel move a little.
00:00:43.560 --> 00:00:46.124
The modes can work together, or alone, and
00:00:46.124 --> 00:00:49.465
both use a forward-facing
camera to detect lane drift.
00:00:49.465 --> 00:00:50.623
Still with me?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg3.mp4
question: What system does Aid Mode use?

video_trans:

To activate Sport Mode, press the button
on the end of the gear shift lever twice
00:00:40.140 --> 00:00:44.680

00:00:44.680 --> 00:00:47.770
The sport indicator light will

letting you know it's activated.

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
00:00:26.130 --> 00:00:29.690
During cold and hot weather,
you'll see reduced electric range.
00:00:29.690 --> 00:00:33.220
To help minimize this loss in
range in cold weather conditions,
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.280
use the heated seats, and set your climate
control temperature and fan speed lower
00:00:37.280 --> 00:00:40.870
to help lessen the energy needed for
the high voltage electric heater.
00:00:40.870 --> 00:00:44.010
And for electric only vehicles,
specifically, keeping your vehicle
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.670
plugged in whenever possible will help
maintain the battery temperature.
00:00:47.670 --> 00:00:51.580
It's also recommended that you
pre-heat your cabin while plugged in.
00:00:51.580 --> 00:00:53.640
You can do so through your touchscreen or
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.633
through MyFord Mobile by setting your
planned departure time or go time and
00:00:57.633 --> 00:01:02.180
your desired cabin temperature so that the
system uses the energy from your home or
00:01:02.180 --> 00:01:05.880
charging station, instead of your
vehicle's high voltage battery.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg2.mp4
question: What will happen to electric range during hot and cold weather?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:02.720 --> 00:01:06.560
Circles are shown to help gauge
the power being used by each component.
00:01:06.560 --> 00:01:10.090
The bigger the circle,
the more power that's being used.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg3.mp4
question: What do the circles in the display represent?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg6.mp4
question: How long can you run your car for before you need to restart it?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: where is the five way switch located?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:

Keep in mind, even though you
are manually changing gears,
00:00:43.575 --> 00:00:45.910
SelectShift will automatically
make some shifts for
00:00:45.910 --> 00:00:50.190
you, if your enter speed is to high,
or if your RPMs are too low.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:52.970
And once you've gone into Sport Mode,
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:55.470
your car will stay there until
you shift back to Drive Mode.

video_trans:

You'll also find
a Connection Checklist tab.
00:01:31.460 --> 00:01:33.332
Here, you can select a particular trailer,
00:01:33.332 --> 00:01:35.540

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the jack located in the vehicle?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: Where can I find how to connect a trailer?

video_name: Smart Trailer Tow Connector _ Ford How-To _ Ford-iOv4Uin0pKo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.720
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.720 --> 00:00:08.109
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that monitors key components of
00:00:08.109 --> 00:00:10.120
a trailer that you are towing.
00:00:10.120 --> 00:00:11.580
Let me explain.
00:00:11.580 --> 00:00:15.590
The smart trailer tow connector informs
you if something regarding your trailer
00:00:15.590 --> 00:00:19.820
needs your attention via your productivity
screen under the Towing menu.
00:00:19.820 --> 00:00:23.888
Such as burned out or unlit trailer
turn signal lamps, brake lights, and
00:00:23.888 --> 00:00:25.474
trailer battery problems.
00:00:25.474 --> 00:00:28.884
Any questions, go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:28.884 --> 00:00:38.884
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Smart Trailer Tow Connector _ Ford How-To _ Ford-iOv4Uin0pKo_seg1.mp4
question: what does the tow trailer connector do?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: What to do if I am not able to select Line Lock?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:01:00.340 --> 00:01:02.980
Of course, if you'd rather not
use the Brake Coach feature,
00:01:02.980 --> 00:01:05.170
you can disable it using
the five-way control.
00:01:05.170 --> 00:01:12.317
Going back to your Settings menu,
then Display, Brake Coach, and Off.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg4.mp4
question: Can you turn the Brake Coach feature off?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:38.782 --> 00:02:43.168
Keep in mind, you can cancel adaptive cruise
control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965
pressing the cancel button on
the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489
the adaptive cruise control and allow you
to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.
 
00:02:56.790 --> 00:02:57.996
Any questions?
00:02:57.996 --> 00:02:59.971
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:02:59.971 --> 00:03:01.889
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg10.mp4
question: What happens when you press the "Resume" button on the steering wheel?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:52.520 --> 00:00:55.868
If you want to change the strength of
the alert vibration you car gives you,
00:00:55.868 --> 00:00:58.497
you can adjust the intensity
in the Message Center.
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:02.942
And since the system stores your settings,
you just have to press the on/off switch
00:01:02.942 --> 00:01:05.642
when you start your vehicle and
you're good to go.
00:01:05.642 --> 00:01:06.710
Any questions?

question: How do you adjust the intensity of the

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:04.983 --> 00:00:07.064
Did you know that you can
manually change gears,
00:00:07.064 --> 00:00:09.550
even though your car has
an automatic transmission?
00:00:09.550 --> 00:00:14.760
Let me explain, with SelectShift,
not only can you easily shift gears,
00:00:14.760 --> 00:00:17.320
you don't have to worry about
using the clutch either.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg2.mp4

features that make connecting a trailer

and towing it simple.

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:57.030 --> 00:01:59.800
To lift the seat out of
the stowed position, squeeze and
00:01:59.800 --> 00:02:01.960
pull up on the handle as you lift.
00:02:01.960 --> 00:02:05.000
The seat will lift out of
the floor in a folded position.
00:02:05.000 --> 00:02:08.310
So just push it back to lock
it into the floor latches.
00:02:08.310 --> 00:02:13.038
Then, move your seat back into the upright
position by pulling strap number 1 and
00:02:13.038 --> 00:02:14.901
the long strap on the seat back.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg10.mp4

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:16.040 --> 00:00:19.980
The charge cord may be located behind
the driver's seat, depending on model.
00:00:19.980 --> 00:00:22.880
Just lift the carpeted
floor panel to access it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg2.mp4
question: Where do I look for the charge code?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg4.mp4
question: What is the advantage of using the tow/haul mode when travelling with a trailer and performing low speed manuevers?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:17.060 --> 00:00:20.910
To unlock your doors, just grab a front
door handle being sure not to touch
00:00:20.910 --> 00:00:24.810
the lock and unlock sensor simultaneously,
then pull and you're in.

helpful when hooking up a trailer and

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg7.mp4

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions

[MUSIC]

00:00:09.536 --> 00:00:13.620

video_name: Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0
video_trans:
00:00:25.708 --> 00:00:28.180
To turn it on, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:32.135
a 360 degree view will
display on the center screen.
00:00:32.135 --> 00:00:34.475
Touch the expand button, here.
00:00:34.475 --> 00:00:36.945
Then touch the high-mounted camera button.
00:00:36.945 --> 00:00:40.905
When you do, the image also gives you
a dynamic guideline to help locate
00:00:40.905 --> 00:00:43.585
the center of your vehicle for
lining up a trailer.
00:00:43.585 --> 00:00:47.945
For a closer look, you can zoom in on
the image by touching the + button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0_seg3.mp4

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:22.760 --> 00:01:26.507
Finally, a helpful table gate lamp
offers lighting for the hitch area
00:01:26.507 --> 00:01:28.385
for easy trailer hook ups at night.
00:01:28.385 --> 00:01:33.193
To turn it on, use the same button you
used to turn on the box interior lights.
00:01:33.193 --> 00:01:34.274
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg5.mp4

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:41.900
To access the other two cup holders and
storage bin, pull the middle seat back
00:00:41.900 --> 00:00:46.540
down by pushing the button on
the passenger side of the console, here.
00:00:46.540 --> 00:00:50.180
You can open the storage
bin by squeezing the small latch.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.160
For your added security, this storage bin
will only open when the seat is folded.
00:00:54.160 --> 00:00:57.783
So there's no worry of things falling
out when it's in the upright position.
00:00:57.783 --> 00:01:02.415
And keep in mind, because the cup holders
have small rubber pads on the inside,
00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg3.mp4
question: How can the storage bin be opened?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:36.640 --> 00:00:39.860
Aid mode uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer your vehicle
00:00:39.860 --> 00:00:41.220
towards your lane.
00:00:41.220 --> 00:00:43.560
You'll actually feel
the wheel move a little.
00:00:43.560 --> 00:00:46.124
The modes can work together, or alone, and
00:00:46.124 --> 00:00:49.465
both use a forward-facing
camera to detect lane drift.
00:00:49.465 --> 00:00:50.623
Still with me?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg3.mp4

And, when needed, can be easily

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:55.160 --> 00:00:58.500
Now I'll tell you about some of
the on-road features that can help make
00:00:58.505 --> 00:01:00.812
hauling a trailer a little more convenient.
00:01:00.812 --> 00:01:04.593
Available power scope mirrors will
integrated spotlights can extend
00:01:04.593 --> 00:01:08.052
out an additional three inches with
just the press of a button for
00:01:08.052 --> 00:01:09.286
a wider viewing area.

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:58.335 --> 00:01:04.330
To turn Autolock on or off, press the door
unlock button, then the door lock button.
00:01:04.330 --> 00:01:06.658
The horn will chirp once
if Autolock was turned off.
00:01:06.658 --> 00:01:13.142
Or twice, [NOISE] one short chirp, and
one long chirp if Autolock was turned on.

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: Where can I find the Brake Coach feature?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:22.218 --> 00:01:25.740
When you shift into drive,
you'll have to push the camera button for
00:01:25.740 --> 00:01:28.690
front view as it doesn't
automatically come on.
00:01:28.690 --> 00:01:31.900
When you do, it will show
a full screen with a 360-degree
00:01:31.900 --> 00:01:36.170
image on the right side of the screen and
a normal front view on the left side.
00:01:36.170 --> 00:01:40.620
Press it again for a normal front view and
once again for a front-split view.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg8.mp4

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: how does regenerative braking work?

video_trans:

Kind: captions

00:00:04.259 --> 00:00:07.200
Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876
your vehicle to monitor and
provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350

are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850
Let me explain.
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]

question: What happens when TPMS detects that the air pressure of the tyres on the trailer is low?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: How do you use the power outlets in a Ford F-Series vehicle?

00:00:44.330 --> 00:00:48.070

To reset sound levels back to
the original default setting,
00:00:51.000 --> 00:00:54.500
just press the Reset All button, here.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:38.526 --> 00:01:39.932
To remove the battery cover,
00:01:39.932 --> 00:01:44.100
first remove the small panel that
covers the negative battery cable.
00:01:44.100 --> 00:01:47.050
Once the panel is off, you'll need
to loosen the nuts on the negative
00:01:47.050 --> 00:01:49.680
pull clamps and
remove the cable from the battery.
00:01:49.680 --> 00:01:52.608
Next, unsnap the tab in the front, here.
00:01:52.608 --> 00:01:55.984
Then, slide the lid forward until
the two additional front-side tabs
00:01:55.984 --> 00:01:57.830
come unattached.
00:01:57.830 --> 00:02:01.028
Now, lift and pull the cover to remove it.
00:02:01.028 --> 00:02:03.426
Then, loosen the nuts on
the positive pull clamps and
00:02:03.426 --> 00:02:05.580
remove the clamps from the battery.
00:02:05.580 --> 00:02:09.139
Be sure to use the lift handles
provided when removing the batteries,
00:02:09.139 --> 00:02:10.539
since they are very heavy.
00:02:10.539 --> 00:02:14.739
You may have a single battery. To replace
it with the cover panel off, loosen and
00:02:14.739 --> 00:02:17.060
remove the negative pull clamp.
00:02:17.060 --> 00:02:20.798
Then rotate the battery and
remove the positive pull clamp.
00:02:20.798 --> 00:02:24.062
To install the new battery,
just follow the same directions, but
00:02:24.062 --> 00:02:25.180
in the reverse order.
00:02:26.520 --> 00:02:30.043
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg5.mp4
question: What do you need to do to remove the battery cover?

00:00:48.915 --> 00:00:51.115

00:00:51.115 --> 00:00:55.894

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:37.500
With your gear shift lever in D,
00:00:37.500 --> 00:00:41.000
press the minus button to activate
progressive range selection.
00:00:41.000 --> 00:00:43.490
When you do,
you'll see the available gears
00:00:43.490 --> 00:00:47.150
as well as the current gear
indicated on the instrument cluster.
00:00:47.150 --> 00:00:51.350
So, if you press the minus button once,
it will lock out sixth gear.
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:54.230
And press it again to lock out fifth,
and so on.
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.640
Once you lock out gears,
only the available gears will be shown and
00:00:57.640 --> 00:00:59.960
your transmission will
automatically shift between them.
00:01:01.000 --> 00:01:03.950
The unlocked gears will automatically
reappear in the display
00:01:03.950 --> 00:01:05.070
when you restart your vehicle.
00:01:06.580 --> 00:01:09.170
To unlock a gear,
just press the plus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg3.mp4
question: how to unlock gear with gear shift lever?

menu on the touch screen.
00:00:21.010 --> 00:00:23.690
It's the one that looks like gears, here.
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:27.230
From here, you could personalize
several of your SYNC 3 features.
00:00:27.230 --> 00:00:31.040
You can set the clock by touching the
Clock tile as well as set automatic time
00:00:31.040 --> 00:00:34.790
zone updates, which adjusts the clock to
match the time zone you're driving in.

You'll know it's locked when

video_name: Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.216
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.216 --> 00:00:06.520
Did you know that your vehicle can
sense when something is behind you?
00:00:06.520 --> 00:00:10.020
It can, thanks to an available
reverse sensing system.
00:00:10.020 --> 00:00:11.940
Let me show you how it works.
00:00:11.940 --> 00:00:16.397
If your vehicle is in reverse, like when
you're backing out of or into a parking
00:00:16.397 --> 00:00:20.454
spot or garage, the reverse sensing
uses sensors on the rear bumpers and
00:00:20.454 --> 00:00:23.804
a warning sound to let you know
if something's behind you.
00:00:23.804 --> 00:00:27.069
If you have both forward and
reverse sensing, sensors on the front and
00:00:27.069 --> 00:00:30.450
back of your vehicle will detect
objects when you're in reverse.
00:00:30.450 --> 00:00:33.392
This is really helpful when you're
parallel parking since your front bumper
00:00:33.392 --> 00:00:34.669
swings when you're backing up.
00:00:34.669 --> 00:00:36.614
[MUSIC]
00:00:36.614 --> 00:00:41.960
And one more thing, the sensors have to be
clear of snow, ice, or mud to work right.
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:46.220
So make sure to check them periodically
and be aware that outside conditions or
00:00:46.220 --> 00:00:48.690
noises may also trigger the system.
00:00:48.690 --> 00:00:49.800
Any questions?
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:51.377
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:51.377 --> 00:01:01.377
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0_seg1.mp4
question: What do the front and rare sensors of the car do?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: Where on the steering wheel do I find the break coach tutorial?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:32.560
While you're in park, neutral, or drive,
press the camera button above the CD slot
00:00:32.560 --> 00:00:35.920
once to see either a front, normal view,
which gives you an image of
00:00:35.920 --> 00:00:39.620
what's directly in front of you,
or again, for a front split-view,
00:00:39.620 --> 00:00:42.720
which gives you a 180 degree extended
view of what's in front of you.
00:00:43.750 --> 00:00:46.900
That can be helpful, as it gives you added
visibility when you're pulling out of
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.450
a driveway, street, parking spot,
or while maneuvering.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg3.mp4

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.

video_name: Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk
video_trans:
00:00:10.139 --> 00:00:14.473
Dynamic Hitch Assist is part of the rear
view camera system on your truck.
00:00:14.473 --> 00:00:17.767
It helps you line up the center of the
truck to your trailer from inside using
00:00:17.767 --> 00:00:20.606
a black dotted line that moves
when you move the steering wheel.
00:00:20.606 --> 00:00:24.800
The black line is displayed on
your eight inch LCD touchscreen.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:27.165
Because you can see the exact
angle of your truck and
00:00:27.165 --> 00:00:31.015
trailer the whole time you're backing up,
you can line up your truck's hitch with
00:00:31.015 --> 00:00:34.454
the trailer without a spotter and
without getting out of your truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk_seg2.mp4
question: When the black dotted line moves, what else is moving?

video_trans:

Charge screen is located
00:00:16.370 --> 00:00:19.990
in the display trip menu on the left
side of the instrument cluster, and
00:00:19.990 --> 00:00:23.520

instantaneous miles per charge.

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:00:48.740 --> 00:00:53.530
If you're not sure what type of
lights you have, look for the VOL or
00:00:53.530 --> 00:00:54.730
VOR mark on your lamps.
00:00:55.900 --> 00:00:59.960
If you have HID lamps, you'll want
the top of the beam to be about two
00:00:59.960 --> 00:01:01.800
inches below the tape mark you made.
00:01:01.800 --> 00:01:07.080
If you have halogen lamps, the top of the
beam should be right on your tape mark.
00:01:07.080 --> 00:01:08.320
Still with me?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.

question: what does the connection checklist do?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: How does the Alert System work?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4
question: What does it mean when you see red?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: What must be done to have have Blind Spot Trailer active during towing?

00:00:45.591 --> 00:00:50.590
If for any reason it doesn't engage
reverse gear, press the clutch pedal down,
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:55.532
take it out of gear, release the clutch
pedal, then repeat the process again.

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:01:04.590 --> 00:01:07.780
Using the navigation system
has also been simplified, so
00:01:07.780 --> 00:01:12.750
finding your nearest favorite coffee shop,
ATM, or any other popular destination
00:01:12.750 --> 00:01:17.580
can now be done quickly, thanks to
condensed destination entry functionality.
00:01:17.580 --> 00:01:21.530
Plus SYNC 3 remembers what you searched,
like coffee shops and
00:01:21.530 --> 00:01:23.200
saves it in its memory.
00:01:23.200 --> 00:01:26.820
So the next time you search for
a coffee shop, it'll remember and preload
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:30.800
POI search results based on the letters
you type and show you the closest one.

video_trans:

your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295

at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: Can we use alcohol to clean the surface of exterior chrom finsish?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: Should I do the top or bottom anchor points first?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: What are the steps to initiating line lock?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.920
In an addition to
the traditional gear selections,
00:00:22.920 --> 00:00:26.330
your transmission has
two additional modes.
00:00:26.330 --> 00:00:28.990
Progressive range selection
that lets you lock out
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.690
upper gears when the truck is heavily
loaded or when towing on grades.
00:00:32.690 --> 00:00:35.750
And manual,
that lets you manually select gears.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg2.mp4
question: How many transition modes can I select?

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
00:00:26.130 --> 00:00:29.690
During cold and hot weather,
you'll see reduced electric range.
00:00:29.690 --> 00:00:33.220
To help minimize this loss in
range in cold weather conditions,
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.280
use the heated seats, and set your climate
control temperature and fan speed lower
00:00:37.280 --> 00:00:40.870
to help lessen the energy needed for
the high voltage electric heater.
00:00:40.870 --> 00:00:44.010
And for electric only vehicles,
specifically, keeping your vehicle
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.670
plugged in whenever possible will help
maintain the battery temperature.
00:00:47.670 --> 00:00:51.580
It's also recommended that you
pre-heat your cabin while plugged in.
00:00:51.580 --> 00:00:53.640
You can do so through your touchscreen or
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.633
through MyFord Mobile by setting your
planned departure time or go time and
00:00:57.633 --> 00:01:02.180
your desired cabin temperature so that the
system uses the energy from your home or
00:01:02.180 --> 00:01:05.880
charging station, instead of your
vehicle's high voltage battery.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg2.mp4
question: What is the name of the mobile app for preheating the cabin on electric vehicles?

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: What do you use to change the options on the MyView screen?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg3.mp4
question: What does the blinking light in the mirror mean?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:04.980 --> 00:01:09.490
You also have a Towing tab which can be
very helpful if you do a lot of towing.
00:01:09.490 --> 00:01:12.770
Just use the five-way switch on your
steering wheel to scroll to towing.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:16.490
Then view trailer status, which tells
you which trailer you're connected to,
00:01:16.490 --> 00:01:20.140
the accumulated miles on it, and
the trailer's breaking output and
00:01:20.140 --> 00:01:24.498
gain status. Trailer options, which lets
you turn the Trailer Sway Control feature
00:01:24.498 --> 00:01:28.840
on, change trailers, delete,
rename, and add a trailer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg4.mp4
question: how to change or add a trailer?

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]

00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710

prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: What is the torque of the car?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4
question: How to check the Power flow in your vehicle?

To start your vehicle,
once inside just press and
00:00:57.547 --> 00:01:01.320
hold the brake pedal while you
push the Engine Start Stop button.
00:01:01.320 --> 00:01:06.450
To turn it off, be sure the vehicle is in
park and push the Start Stop button again.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: How many screws are needed to be undone in order to see the battery?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg4.mp4
question: At what minimum speed is trailer coverage active?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the Launch Control feature  located?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg3.mp4
question: How do I turn it off?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:00:28.130 --> 00:00:31.080
To raise or lower the seat,
pull up on the lever located on
00:00:31.080 --> 00:00:35.190
the side of the seat closest to the door
to raise it and press down to lower it.
00:00:36.770 --> 00:00:39.680
You can also change the angle
of the seatback by pulling up on
00:00:39.680 --> 00:00:41.980
the adjustment lever on
the side of the seatback.
00:00:41.980 --> 00:00:45.490
Leaning backward or forward to the desired
position and then releasing the lever.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg3.mp4
question: How to change the angle of your seat?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:22.218 --> 00:01:25.740
When you shift into drive,
you'll have to push the camera button for
00:01:25.740 --> 00:01:28.690
front view as it doesn't
automatically come on.
00:01:28.690 --> 00:01:31.900
When you do, it will show
a full screen with a 360-degree
00:01:31.900 --> 00:01:36.170
image on the right side of the screen and
a normal front view on the left side.
00:01:36.170 --> 00:01:40.620
Press it again for a normal front view and
once again for a front-split view.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg8.mp4
question: How do you see a normal front view on the screen

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:02:22.810 --> 00:02:27.370
Keep in mind you can also run a Vehicle
Health Report using voice commands.
00:02:27.370 --> 00:02:29.470
Just use the voice button
on your steering wheel and
00:02:29.470 --> 00:02:32.898
say Vehicle Health, it's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg7.mp4

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: Does waxing protect the chrome surfaces on my vehicle?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:01:28.318 --> 00:01:30.480
The Search channels using voice command,
00:01:30.480 --> 00:01:32.680
use the voice button on your
steering wheel, wait for
00:01:32.680 --> 00:01:37.990
the beep then say browse Sirius, and
a full list of categories will appear.
00:01:37.990 --> 00:01:42.270
Touch the one you want to hear and once
you decide, touch the voice button and
00:01:42.270 --> 00:01:45.390
then say the channel number,
like, Sirius channel 36.
00:01:45.390 --> 00:01:50.290
Or you can use the Voice button and just
say the name or number of the channel,
00:01:50.290 --> 00:01:54.200
like ALT Nation, for example,
and it will tune to that channel.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg5.mp4
question: How do I get to the Sirius station browsing section?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: HOW TO UNDERSTAND THE POLE IS EXTENDED ?

video_name: Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8
video_trans:
00:00:15.923 --> 00:00:19.785
You can set your headlamps and tail lamps
to come on any time you use your wipers.
00:00:19.785 --> 00:00:20.612
[MUSIC]
00:00:20.612 --> 00:00:23.145
When your windshield wipers
are in the on position and and
00:00:23.145 --> 00:00:25.680
your headlights are switched
to the Autolamp position,
00:00:25.680 --> 00:00:27.735
your lights will
automatically turn on too.
00:00:27.735 --> 00:00:28.548
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.548 --> 00:00:32.677
And that makes it easier for others
drivers to see you when the weather and
00:00:32.677 --> 00:00:34.065
the visibility is bad.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8_seg2.mp4
question: What can you set to come on any time you use your wipers?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: How do I get an overview of how the brake coach works?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:01:32.330 --> 00:01:34.860
Another convienient feature
is that you get automatic
00:01:34.860 --> 00:01:36.640
updates via Wi-Fi with SYNC 3.
00:01:36.640 --> 00:01:41.380
Now you can easily update your SYNC
software when a new version is available.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg5.mp4

video_name: Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8
video_trans:
00:00:34.065 --> 00:00:35.275
[MUSIC]
00:00:35.275 --> 00:00:38.388
In addition, when your headlamps
are in the Autolamp position,
00:00:38.388 --> 00:00:40.550
they automatically turn on when it's dark.
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:45.461
And stay on for up to three minutes
after you turn off the car and get out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8_seg3.mp4

Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.

Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.

And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg2.mp4

video_trans:

You can also open your trunk or
lift gate without using the key
00:00:47.977 --> 00:00:51.820
by pressing the soft button switch
