video_name: Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.259
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.259 --> 00:00:07.200
Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876
your vehicle to monitor and
provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350
a trailer that you're towing
are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850
Let me explain.
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0_seg1.mp4
question: How does the trailer tire pressure monitoring system work in the vehicle?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:30.320 --> 00:01:34.050
In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from.
00:01:34.050 --> 00:01:38.140
One bar, or the sportiest setting,
gets you the smallest gap.
00:01:38.140 --> 00:01:40.720
Two bars, which is the default gap.
00:01:40.720 --> 00:01:45.680
Three bars, or four, which is the comfort
setting and gives you the biggest gap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg7.mp4
question: How many gap settings are there?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:26.970 --> 00:00:27.820
Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740
First, you'll need to
access programming mode.
00:00:36.740 --> 00:00:37.316
Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015
[MUSIC]
00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg3.mp4
question: What will happen to indicate successful entering into programming mode?

video_trans:

To open your lift gate,
simply kick your leg forward and
00:00:17.520 --> 00:00:21.310
back under the center of the rear
bumper below the license plate.
00:00:21.310 --> 00:00:23.850
Then step back to give
the gate space to open.

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:09.330 --> 00:00:13.670
Let me explain. Selectable Driving Mode
instantly modifies the electronic
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:17.230
stability control system and traction
control, which help maintain your vehicle's
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:20.170
command of the road in poor conditions,
or high performance driving.
00:00:21.280 --> 00:00:24.220
It also enhances throttle response for
quick acceleration,
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:29.170
crisper transmission shift points,
and finally steering effort and feel.
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:32.270
Together the selectable driving
mounts automatically tailor your
00:00:32.270 --> 00:00:35.290
vehicles performance to
the mode you've selected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg2.mp4

Did you know that your car may be equipped
with a feature that's designed to help
00:00:08.310 --> 00:00:10.150

It's called Auto Start-Stop technology.

Let me explain.

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: How can line lock be manually cancelled?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:56.330 --> 00:00:59.680
Sport +, which gives your vehicle
a sportier steering feel and
00:00:59.680 --> 00:01:03.660
throttle response, and is ideal for
spirited driving situations.

video_trans:
00:01:40.420 --> 00:01:44.360
As you turn the wheel,
you'll see two zones, yellow and red.
00:01:44.360 --> 00:01:48.630
Yellow being a caution alert that warns
you of a potential jackknife position.
00:01:48.630 --> 00:01:52.160
And red signaling that you need to stop,
pull forward, and
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:55.610
put the truck and
trailer back into an inline position.
00:01:55.610 --> 00:01:59.550
One more thing, when using the Straight
Backup mode, a steering wheel graphic
00:01:59.550 --> 00:02:02.920
shows you which way to turn your steering
wheel to keep your trailer straight.
00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:05.060

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your
engine temperature is normal, or high.
00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550

select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540

battery gauge.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the 12-volt battery located?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:00.588 --> 00:01:05.024
High visibility LED box lights in the box
interior make it easy to find and
00:01:05.024 --> 00:01:07.350
load items in the dark.
00:01:07.350 --> 00:01:11.020
There are two lights located in
the rear corners that shine forward.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:14.770
There is also one in the high mounted
stop lamp on the rear of the cab.
00:01:14.770 --> 00:01:19.780
To turn them on and off from inside the
cab, just press the box lighting button, here.
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:22.760
After ten minutes they
will turn off gradually.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg4.mp4
question: How many lights are in the cabin?

video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side
to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg5.mp4
question: How can you program your engine to run intervals?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the relay box?

00:00:09.786 --> 00:00:10.770

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg4.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:38.782 --> 00:02:43.168
Keep in mind, you can cancel adaptive cruise
control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965
pressing the cancel button on
the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489
the adaptive cruise control and allow you
to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.
 
00:02:56.790 --> 00:02:57.996
Any questions?
00:02:57.996 --> 00:02:59.971
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:02:59.971 --> 00:03:01.889
[MUSIC]

question: How to cancel the Adaptive Cruise control feature?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How do I register and configure my notifications for my new vehicle so that I can get email updates about the health of my vehicle?

the vehicle's rate of acceleration

0 to 30 miles per hour,

1/8 mile, or 1/4 mile.

video_trans:
00:01:29.790 --> 00:01:32.390
To fold your third row manual seats flat,
or
00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:36.190
tumble them to stow them in the floor,
then fold your head restraints down by
00:01:36.190 --> 00:01:39.970
pulling the strap in the middle of the
seat back, just below the head restraint.
00:01:39.970 --> 00:01:42.570
Next, fold the seat back
down by pulling and
00:01:42.570 --> 00:01:45.969
holding the number 1 strap, while
you're pushing the seat back forward.
00:01:47.330 --> 00:01:49.870
Once it starts to fold,
let go of the strap.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: How do I access the battery compartment on the transit wagon models?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:29.580 --> 00:00:31.031
To help power your upfit needs,
00:00:31.031 --> 00:00:34.630
we've increased the circuit capacity
over the previous generation.
00:00:34.630 --> 00:00:37.300
There are now four 25 amp circuits.
00:00:37.300 --> 00:00:42.010
Plus two 40 amp circuits which can be
configured to be hot at all times.
00:00:42.010 --> 00:00:43.890
So you don't need to have
the vehicle running for power.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg3.mp4
question: Do I need to have my truck on in order to use the battery power?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.710 --> 00:01:07.320
Now, let me tell you about some of
the other trailering technology.
00:01:08.380 --> 00:01:12.240
A factory installed integrated trailer
brake controller synchronizes your truck
00:01:12.240 --> 00:01:14.820
brakes with the electric brakes
on your trailer for smoother and
00:01:14.820 --> 00:01:15.840
more effective braking.

designed to help alert you when a car is
00:00:08.637 --> 00:00:12.550
in your blind spot or approaching from

Let me tell you how it works.

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880
plus additional information about how your
energy usage has impacted your estimate
00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.

video_trans:

Now I'll tell you about some of
the on-road features that can help make
00:00:58.505 --> 00:01:00.812
hauling a trailer a little more convenient.
00:01:00.812 --> 00:01:04.593
Available power scope mirrors will
integrated spotlights can extend
00:01:04.593 --> 00:01:08.052
out an additional three inches with
just the press of a button for
00:01:08.052 --> 00:01:09.286
a wider viewing area.

video_trans:
00:00:35.359 --> 00:00:38.947
To open the moonroof,
push the open button here.
00:00:38.947 --> 00:00:42.623
The glass panel only opens 80% of the way.
00:00:42.623 --> 00:00:45.691
So just press the button
again to open it completely.

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:59.200 --> 00:01:01.920
There's also a rear view camera,
just above the license plate,
00:01:01.920 --> 00:01:04.260
that works independently from
the one in the front, and
 
00:01:04.260 --> 00:01:07.590
shows what's directly behind
you while you're in reverse.
00:01:07.590 --> 00:01:10.100
Another car icon in the upper
right side of the screen,
00:01:10.100 --> 00:01:13.720
the park distance control display,
also shows up when you're in reverse.
00:01:13.720 --> 00:01:15.290
And uses red, yellow, and
00:01:15.290 --> 00:01:19.380
green indicators to show you where
the closest obstacles detected are.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg5.mp4
question: Where is the rear-view camera located?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg4.mp4
question: How many variables does the trailor status show and measure?

video_name: F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU
video_trans:
00:00:27.220 --> 00:00:32.063
To stow it, push the step in on either
side of the button until it fully latches
00:00:32.063 --> 00:00:33.116
into position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU_seg3.mp4
question: How do I stow the step?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg3.mp4
question: What does fuel economy menu show?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:02:22.810 --> 00:02:27.370
Keep in mind you can also run a Vehicle
Health Report using voice commands.
00:02:27.370 --> 00:02:29.470
Just use the voice button
on your steering wheel and
00:02:29.470 --> 00:02:32.898
say Vehicle Health, it's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg7.mp4
question: What is the voice command for a health report?

video_trans:
00:00:21.330 --> 00:00:24.540
To close your window all the way,
firmly pull up on the switch and let go.
00:00:25.650 --> 00:00:28.060
To close it part way,
pull up lightly and let go.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg2.mp4
question: Do I firmly press down and let go on the switch if I want to open the window all the way?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: How do you extend the life of the chrome on your vehicle?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:56.180 --> 00:01:58.840
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:02.180
To cool down your vehicle quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:02.180 --> 00:02:05.850
turn the nob toward the cool
setting to reduce the temperature.
00:02:05.850 --> 00:02:08.476
To warm your vehicle up quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:08.480 --> 00:02:11.160
turn your nob toward the warm
setting to increase it.
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.036
To quickly defrost the windshield and side
windows, press the Max defrost button.
00:02:16.036 --> 00:02:17.348
Both the temperature and
00:02:17.348 --> 00:02:21.070
fan speed will automatically
adjust to the highest settings.
00:02:21.070 --> 00:02:21.710
In mild or
00:02:21.710 --> 00:02:25.910
warm temperatures, you may notice
that your A/C automatically turns on.
00:02:25.910 --> 00:02:29.300
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg9.mp4
question: What do you press to cool down your vehicle quickly?

video_trans:
WEBVTT

Language: en

[MUSIC]

You might be interested to know that

an integrated electronic Trailer
Brake Controller, or TBC,
00:00:09.594 --> 00:00:13.410
that can help make braking with
a trailer attached smooth and effective.
00:00:13.410 --> 00:00:14.730
Let me tell you about it.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg9.mp4
question: How does the vehicle adjust to trailer weight?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:00:16.490 --> 00:00:20.200
To adjust the manual seat lift the bar
located in front of the seat and
00:00:20.200 --> 00:00:21.110
slide your seat forward.
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:24.650
Or backward to your desired position and
release the bar.
00:00:24.650 --> 00:00:28.130
Be sure to rock the seat a little to
make sure it's locked into place.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg2.mp4
question: How to adjust the front seat to the proper position ?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg2.mp4
question: Where can images of areas surrounding your vehicle be viewed?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the step release button?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg4.mp4
question: How do you get to the charge port light settings?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: Does Blis warn you of oncoming vehicles?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg3.mp4
question: Where is trip fuel mode located?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:01:34.090 --> 00:01:38.040
Of course, if you rather not use the
ECO Cruise feature it can be turned off
00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:41.265
using the five we controls on
the left side of the steering wheel.
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.130
And scroll into settings in
your information display.
00:01:44.130 --> 00:01:47.490
Drivers Assist ECO Cruise then off.
00:01:47.490 --> 00:01:51.140
When ECO Cruise has been turned off
the next time you set a cruising speed,
00:01:51.140 --> 00:01:52.724
you will be using standard cruise control.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg5.mp4
question: How do I turn ECO Cruise off?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: How do you switch to adaptive or normal cruise control?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg2.mp4
question: What sound will you hear when it's locked into its final position?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:49.870 --> 00:01:54.070
To tumble the seats all the way into
the floor, pull the number 2 strap and
00:01:54.070 --> 00:01:57.030
the strap on the top of
the seat back at the same time.

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: What button should be pressed finally for display as 'my view'?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: Where is the key fob pocket located in your car?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.920
In an addition to
the traditional gear selections,
00:00:22.920 --> 00:00:26.330
your transmission has
two additional modes.
00:00:26.330 --> 00:00:28.990
Progressive range selection
that lets you lock out
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.690
upper gears when the truck is heavily
loaded or when towing on grades.
00:00:32.690 --> 00:00:35.750
And manual,
that lets you manually select gears.

question: What are the differences between automated and manual gear selections?

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:04.630 --> 00:00:07.470
Did you know that there are a few
things you can do to maximize
00:00:07.470 --> 00:00:10.140
the electric range of your
plug in hybrid vehicle?
00:00:10.140 --> 00:00:13.560
As with any vehicle, there are some
basic rules you can follow.
00:00:13.560 --> 00:00:14.980
Let me explain.
00:00:14.980 --> 00:00:18.350
For starters, make sure to keep
your tires properly inflated,
00:00:18.350 --> 00:00:22.610
accelerate gradually from a stop,
brake smoothly, use heat and
00:00:22.610 --> 00:00:26.130
air conditioning moderately,
and maintain the speed limit.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg1.mp4
question: What does it do to the brakes

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: In what ratio does the rear seat splits?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the top tether anchor located?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:13.850 --> 00:01:18.030
You can adjust your follow distance using
the gap control on your steering wheel.
00:01:18.030 --> 00:01:20.950
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:01:20.950 --> 00:01:23.910
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:01:23.910 --> 00:01:26.589
And pressing it down increases
your follow distance and
00:01:26.589 --> 00:01:30.320
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.

video_trans:

Your vehicle may also have an automatic
Dual-Zone temperature control system.

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: How can you fold the rear seat backs ?

video_name: Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0
video_trans:
00:00:17.339 --> 00:00:22.790
The center console has room for CD cases,
media devices, and charging cords.
00:00:22.790 --> 00:00:26.180
As well as a coin tray to store extra
change so you don't have to dig for
00:00:26.180 --> 00:00:27.590
it the next time you need it.
00:00:27.590 --> 00:00:32.810
The center console is also equipped with
a USB port, an auxiliary input jack and
00:00:32.810 --> 00:00:36.240
an SD card slot so
you can plug in your media devices.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0_seg3.mp4
question: What features does the center console have?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How can I register for the Ford website?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg6.mp4
question: How long will the charge port lights stay on?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:59.490 --> 00:02:02.630
To run a report,
press Run Vehicle Health Report Now.
00:02:03.800 --> 00:02:06.250
You'll then get a running
report confirmation message.
00:02:06.250 --> 00:02:10.490
The vehicle must've been running for
at least a minute before running a report.
00:02:11.660 --> 00:02:15.040
Once it's finished running the report,
you'll receive a text message letting you
00:02:15.040 --> 00:02:16.760
know that you can now
view it in your email.
00:02:17.810 --> 00:02:19.090
If there is a problem,
00:02:19.090 --> 00:02:22.810
you can access dealer information
from your email to scheduled service.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg6.mp4
question: How long does the vehicle have to be running before running a report?

you might be interested in.

To cool down your car
quickly while in auto mode,

Or press the MAX A/C button,

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:09.570 --> 00:02:13.270
You may also notice that the charge
cord has multiple LED indicators
00:02:13.270 --> 00:02:17.580
to indicate that charging is in progress
or if any problems have occurred.
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.340
When plugged into an AC outlet,
and you see a solid green light,
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:24.080
power is available, but
vehicle charging has not begun.
00:02:25.470 --> 00:02:27.770
A flashing green light means
the vehicle is charging.
00:02:28.960 --> 00:02:32.270
If you see a flashing
solid red triangle LED,
00:02:32.270 --> 00:02:37.290
a ground fault circuit interrupter fault
or charge cord fault has been detected.
00:02:37.290 --> 00:02:41.610
However, if at any time you see a flashing
amber LED light in the shape of an outlet
00:02:41.610 --> 00:02:46.020
plug, that means high temperature
at the AC plug has been detected.
00:02:46.020 --> 00:02:48.610
Have the outlet checked by
a qualified electrician and
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:50.839
make sure the AC plug fits
firmly into the outlet.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg7.mp4
question: What does a solid green LED mean on the power?

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: how do smart usb chargers work?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: How many straps are found on the back of the second row seat?

video_trans:

You can also input preset channels for
quick selection.
00:02:34.300 --> 00:02:37.362

you wish to save, then touch and
00:02:37.362 --> 00:02:39.360
hold one of the memory preset buttons.
00:02:39.360 --> 00:02:44.420
The sound will mute for a brief moment
before resuming when the channel is saved.
00:02:44.420 --> 00:02:48.730
To add or view additional preset channels,
just touch the preset button.
00:02:48.730 --> 00:02:53.960
You can save up to 18 Sirius XM channels
with the three sets of presets.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: What does the sticker placement look like on the trailer hitch?

video_trans:
00:00:54.660 --> 00:00:58.290
Active Park Assist can also help you get
out of a tight parallel parking space,
00:00:58.290 --> 00:01:01.080
which is great if someone is parked
too close in front of or behind you.
00:01:02.190 --> 00:01:05.320
Just press the same active park
assist button you used to park.
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:08.410
Let go of the steering wheel then
simply follow the prompts displayed on
00:01:08.410 --> 00:01:09.370
your screen.
00:01:09.370 --> 00:01:12.750
Once again you just accelerate,
shift, and brake as needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg3.mp4
question: What feature on this vehicle helps you to get out of tight parking situations?

video_trans:
00:00:35.359 --> 00:00:38.947
To open the moonroof,
push the open button here.
00:00:38.947 --> 00:00:42.623
The glass panel only opens 80% of the way.
00:00:42.623 --> 00:00:45.691
So just press the button
again to open it completely.

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: What do you need to do with the 5 amp fuse?

video_trans:

button on the touch screen to get a closer
00:01:48.390 --> 00:01:49.960

When connecting a trailer,

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: What does the rear safety belt use to inflate itself in the event of a crash?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:32.170 --> 00:01:34.792
Once the data of cruise is on,
it uses radar and
00:01:34.792 --> 00:01:39.048
camera technology to constantly scan for
slower vehicles in front of you.
00:01:39.048 --> 00:01:42.403
And automatically adjusts your
speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:42.403 --> 00:01:46.639
You may notice that on occasion, you go
slower than you initially set your cruise for.
00:01:46.639 --> 00:01:49.018
That's the system adjusting the speed.
00:01:49.018 --> 00:01:52.902
Once traffic speeds up,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg7.mp4
question: how does the system adjust the speed?

00:00:14.355 --> 00:00:17.840
Let's start with BLIS or

00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:19.930
Any time you put your vehicle in drive and
00:00:19.930 --> 00:00:23.140
you are going faster than six

00:00:23.140 --> 00:00:27.410
After that it's always active when
your vehicle is drive or neutral.

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: What kind of cleaners can I use on the chrome finish?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ_seg1.mp4
question: How to lock the steering column?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:01:53.105 --> 00:01:57.020
If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg3.mp4
question: What should you select for trailer reverse guidance?

video_trans:
00:00:45.850 --> 00:00:48.990
The acceleration timer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration
00:00:48.990 --> 00:00:51.500
based on selected tests for speed.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:55.305
0 to 30 miles per hour,
0 to 60 miles per hour,
00:00:55.305 --> 00:00:57.775
0 to 100 miles per hour, or distance.
00:00:57.775 --> 00:00:59.665
1/8 mile, or 1/4 mile.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg3.mp4
question: WHAT IS THE SPEED OF THE ACCELERATION TIMER?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:01:53.105 --> 00:01:57.020
If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg3.mp4
question: What is the function of Blind Spot Information System?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:52.520 --> 00:00:55.868
If you want to change the strength of
the alert vibration you car gives you,
00:00:55.868 --> 00:00:58.497
you can adjust the intensity
in the Message Center.
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:02.942
And since the system stores your settings,
you just have to press the on/off switch
00:01:02.942 --> 00:01:05.642
when you start your vehicle and
you're good to go.
00:01:05.642 --> 00:01:06.710
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg4.mp4
question: What does adjusting the intensity do?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: What conditions are summer tires designed for?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4
question: What does rpm control do?

video_name: Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q
video_trans:
00:00:28.647 --> 00:00:32.229
Your brakes also have something
called a Drive Away Release.
00:00:32.229 --> 00:00:36.990
Once you've closed the door, buckled in,
turned on the ignition, shifted into
00:00:36.990 --> 00:00:41.971
gear and pressed the accelerator, your
parking brake will automatically release.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q_seg4.mp4

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg5.mp4
question: Can I connect the trailer automatically?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg5.mp4
question: What happens when I am going at a slower speed than I set?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: What order do I plug in the plug to charge my vehicle, into the wall or into the vehicle first?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:37.440 --> 00:00:40.470
First, make sure your window
is closed all the way.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.300
Then, pull and hold the window
switch up for two seconds and
00:00:43.300 --> 00:00:44.510
repeat that two second hold.

If you want to change the strength of

you can adjust the intensity

00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:02.942
And since the system stores your settings,

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: How do you line up your vehicle and trailer?

video_trans:
00:01:16.870 --> 00:01:19.220
There's also a tow haul mode feature,
00:01:19.220 --> 00:01:23.410
which enhances control when hauling
a trailer up and down steep grades and
00:01:23.410 --> 00:01:25.960
augments transmission operation
when towing a heavy load.

video_name: Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0
video_trans:
00:00:17.339 --> 00:00:22.790
The center console has room for CD cases,
media devices, and charging cords.
00:00:22.790 --> 00:00:26.180
As well as a coin tray to store extra
change so you don't have to dig for
00:00:26.180 --> 00:00:27.590
it the next time you need it.
00:00:27.590 --> 00:00:32.810
The center console is also equipped with
a USB port, an auxiliary input jack and
00:00:32.810 --> 00:00:36.240
an SD card slot so
you can plug in your media devices.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en

[MUSIC].
00:00:04.749 --> 00:00:07.796
For your convenience,
your C-MAX Energi, Fusion Energi, or
00:00:07.796 --> 00:00:12.030
hybrid vehicle allows you to
customize the information display.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:15.990
With MyView, you can choose which
combination of two informational screens or
00:00:15.990 --> 00:00:17.846
columns you want to view on the left side.
