video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4
question: What to the + - gain adjust controls do?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.104 --> 00:00:05.820
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.820 --> 00:00:09.743
The battery in your Transit isn't located
in the engine compartment like other vehicles.
00:00:09.743 --> 00:00:12.730
It's located inside the vehicle
and under the driver's seat.
00:00:12.730 --> 00:00:14.754
And there are a few things
you'll need to know about it.

video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: What is the Pro Trailer Backup Assist used for?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:13.395 --> 00:00:18.150
If your vehicle is equipped with a third
row power fold, you can use the power seat
00:00:18.150 --> 00:00:23.100
buttons located behind the third
row to fold the left, right, or
00:00:23.100 --> 00:00:29.370
both seats to either a stow, fold,
tailgate, or normal position.
00:00:29.370 --> 00:00:31.410
If you have a second row power fold and
00:00:31.410 --> 00:00:33.960
tumble control,
just press the button once, and
00:00:33.960 --> 00:00:38.720
the seat will automatically fold and then
tumble forward to access the third row.

video_trans:

Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.

capability, you can always use the lift
00:00:37.760 --> 00:00:41.700

the button on the instrument panel, or

the button located on the lift gate

00:00:49.620 --> 00:00:54.190
package, to open or close the lift gate,
just kick under the bumper to the left or

right of the tow hitch.

Any questions?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: Where in the cab of the vehicle is the trailer backup button located?

video_name: Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:08.220
Is there any way to keep
my trailer from swaying?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.310
>> Is there any way to reduce
the sway from my trailer?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:16.510
>> For those of you who like to tow,
Ford has something that can help reduce
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:19.330
how much your trailer sways
while you are driving.
00:00:19.330 --> 00:00:20.180
Here's how it works.
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:25.060
If your trailer starts to sway, you'll see
the stability control light flash, and
00:00:25.060 --> 00:00:29.150
a trailer sway reduce speed message
in your information display.
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:32.380
The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.
00:01:02.725 --> 00:01:03.518
Any questions?
00:01:03.518 --> 00:01:04.904
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638_seg1.mp4
question: What do you do when your trailer sways?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: How to properly charge the vehicle?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg3.mp4
question: How does the aid only mode help the driver to steer the car back to the target lane?

video_name: Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.456
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.456 --> 00:00:07.616
Your vehicle has a capless fuel filler
that saves time at the pump and
00:00:07.616 --> 00:00:09.680
keeps your hands cleaner.
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:13.010
There's no cap to twist off and
it's simple to use.
00:00:13.010 --> 00:00:16.510
Just open your fuel door by either
putting a finger under the exposed tab
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:17.530
on the door.
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:19.800
Or by pushing it in a bit
until it releases and
00:00:19.800 --> 00:00:21.470
you can open it the rest of the way.
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.440
Insert the nozzle all the way,
making sure it goes through both flaps.
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:29.290
Fill up, then wait five seconds
before removing the nozzle and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:30.780
close the fuel door.
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:32.840
If you're using a portable fuel container,
00:00:32.840 --> 00:00:36.160
you'll need to use the easy fuel funnel
provided with your vehicle to avoid
00:00:36.160 --> 00:00:38.470
damaging the seals on
the spring loaded flaps.
00:00:39.540 --> 00:00:43.720
And one more thing, to help protect
against fuel theft, splashing, or
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:47.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:51.440
And the self closing, spring loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:51.440 --> 00:00:54.550
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:54.550 --> 00:00:55.650
Any questions?
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:56.919
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:56.919 --> 00:01:06.919
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k_seg1.mp4
question: how to open the fuel door?

00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910

00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:14.380 --> 00:00:16.190
It works a lot like
standard cruise control,
00:00:16.190 --> 00:00:19.196
in that it still maintains
your speed on flat roadways.
00:00:19.196 --> 00:00:21.470
But with ECO Cruise,
when you tap the brake, and
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.410
then want to resume your previously set
speed, it accelerates gradually to get
00:00:25.410 --> 00:00:29.100
your vehicle back up to speed and
that can help save energy.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.160
Be aware that you may experience some
speed loss when first going up hill but
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:37.110
after a short period of time,
it will catch up to your set speed.
00:00:37.110 --> 00:00:39.380
And if equipped with
adaptive cruise control,
00:00:39.380 --> 00:00:43.320
when your vehicle speed is slowed, it will
automatically accelerate again gradually
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:47.890
once traffic is cleared. That gradual
acceleration may make it seem as if your
00:00:47.890 --> 00:00:50.930
vehicle isn't keeping up with
the speed you've set, it is.
00:00:50.930 --> 00:00:53.710
It's just that its more efficient
to gradually accelerate.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg2.mp4
question: What is more efficient to gradually accelerate?

However, if your light flashes rapidly and
then turns to a constant light,
00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899

00:00:50.899 --> 00:00:52.750
Don't worry, I'll walk you through them.
00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032
You'll need to complete the next
few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542
you might want to have someone help
you if you think it would be easier.
00:00:57.542 --> 00:00:59.260
[MUSIC]
00:00:59.260 --> 00:01:03.500
First, press and hold the learn button
on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: How do you access cupholders?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:02:18.170 --> 00:02:21.850
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:02:21.850 --> 00:02:25.340
The sticker acts as a target that
the trailer reverse guidance feature and
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:28.480
rear view camera use to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:29.640 --> 00:02:31.250
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:31.250 --> 00:02:33.830
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:33.830 --> 00:02:36.790
You'll want to place the sticker
within 7 to 22 inches from
00:02:36.790 --> 00:02:38.890
the center of the trailer hitch ball.
00:02:38.890 --> 00:02:42.696
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal surface, so
00:02:42.696 --> 00:02:46.573
the entire sticker is in the acceptable
zone invisible by the rearview camera.
00:02:46.573 --> 00:02:48.293
[MUSIC]
00:02:48.293 --> 00:02:50.430
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:50.430 --> 00:02:54.020
Once the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:54.020 --> 00:02:56.020
record several measurements.
00:02:56.020 --> 00:02:59.880
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:59.880 --> 00:03:01.720
the hitch ball, and write it down.
00:03:01.720 --> 00:03:06.130
Next, measure the horizontal distance
from the center of the hitch ball to
00:03:06.130 --> 00:03:07.746
the center of the sticker.
00:03:07.746 --> 00:03:11.870
And the distance from the rear view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:03:11.870 --> 00:03:15.218
Keep in mind, the location is
not dependent on a straight or
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:20.780
a frame type, but based on where a surface
is available that meets the requirements.
00:03:20.780 --> 00:03:24.740
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:03:24.740 --> 00:03:26.645
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:28.335 --> 00:03:30.685
If the trailer has two or more axles,
00:03:30.685 --> 00:03:34.680
measure to the center point
between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg4.mp4
question: What measurements do you need for the placement of the sticker?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg3.mp4

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:13.640 --> 00:01:16.560
Automatic start allows you to
test at your own pace, and
00:01:16.560 --> 00:01:18.280
begins once you hit the accelerator pedal.
00:01:20.080 --> 00:01:23.580
If you want to end the automatic start,
just hit okay on the five-way switch.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg5.mp4

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.740
If equipped with a diesel engine,
the lower door is available for
00:00:39.740 --> 00:00:42.260
adding diesel exhaust fluid only.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg2.mp4

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:13.280 --> 00:00:14.500
For your convenience,
00:00:14.500 --> 00:00:19.130
built in upfitter switches have been moved
to the overhead console for easy access.
00:00:19.130 --> 00:00:23.000
Plus, we've increased the number
of switches from four to six.
00:00:23.000 --> 00:00:27.292
So now, you have more capability to
control components, such as winches,
00:00:27.292 --> 00:00:29.580
electric spreaders, lights and more.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg2.mp4
question: How many more switches are now available?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:52.520 --> 00:00:55.868
If you want to change the strength of
the alert vibration you car gives you,
00:00:55.868 --> 00:00:58.497
you can adjust the intensity
in the Message Center.
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:02.942
And since the system stores your settings,
you just have to press the on/off switch
00:01:02.942 --> 00:01:05.642
when you start your vehicle and
you're good to go.
00:01:05.642 --> 00:01:06.710
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg4.mp4

[MUSIC]
00:00:03.786 --> 00:00:07.924
You may be interested to know that your
Ford has a feature that allows you to open
00:00:07.924 --> 00:00:12.610
and close your lift gate without using
your hands or pressing any buttons.
00:00:12.610 --> 00:00:13.420
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg1.mp4

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How can I register in the Ford website?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:46.560 --> 00:01:50.580
To turn off Dual-Zone mode,
press the Dual-Zone button again.
00:01:50.580 --> 00:01:53.710
When you do, the passenger side
temperature will automatically
00:01:53.710 --> 00:01:56.180
revert to the driver's side setting.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg8.mp4
question: How do you turn off the duel zone button?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.720
When you're ready to fold up the step,
00:00:45.720 --> 00:00:48.550
press the yellow number 1
button on the extender bar and
00:00:48.550 --> 00:00:51.200
guide it down with your hand to allow
it to lower into the black bar.
00:00:52.680 --> 00:00:57.140
Now, press the yellow number 2
button at the base of the bar, here.
00:00:57.140 --> 00:01:00.245
Fold the bar toward you and
push it back into the tailgate.
00:01:00.245 --> 00:01:02.985
Finally, lift the step up
until it's horizontal and
00:01:02.985 --> 00:01:05.045
push it back into
the tailgate until it clicks.
00:01:06.135 --> 00:01:07.080
One more thing.
00:01:07.080 --> 00:01:11.028
Unlike previous models, the tailgate
handle is stored within the tailgate
00:01:11.028 --> 00:01:14.556
itself, so it's flush to the surface and
nothing is sticking out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg3.mp4
question: How do you fold up the step?

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk_seg1.mp4
question: How to access the rear luggage compartment?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:00.550 --> 00:01:03.930
You can change the camera view you see
using the camera button on the dash
00:01:03.930 --> 00:01:05.820
above the display screen.
00:01:05.820 --> 00:01:08.050
Push it once for a full rear view.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg6.mp4

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:46.090 --> 00:00:48.750
For your safety, your windows
also have a bounce back feature.
00:00:48.750 --> 00:00:51.350
If you're closing a window and
it senses something in the way,
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:53.450
it will automatically stop.
00:00:53.450 --> 00:00:55.750
That way, no one gets hurt and
nothing gets stuck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg5.mp4

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:01:18.930 --> 00:01:22.610
Keep in mind, to help remind you when
power is flowing through the switch,
00:01:22.610 --> 00:01:24.700
it will remain illuminated
to let you know it's on.
00:01:25.880 --> 00:01:26.658
Any questions?
00:01:26.658 --> 00:01:28.720
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:28.720 --> 00:01:38.720
[MUSIC]

question: How do you know if the light switch is on?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:13.850 --> 00:01:18.030
You can adjust your follow distance using
the gap control on your steering wheel.
00:01:18.030 --> 00:01:20.950
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:01:20.950 --> 00:01:23.910
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:01:23.910 --> 00:01:26.589
And pressing it down increases
your follow distance and
00:01:26.589 --> 00:01:30.320
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg6.mp4
question: How do you adjust your follow distance?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:01:06.360 --> 00:01:09.450
And if you want to adjust
your interior illumination,
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.920
meaning how bright your instrument
lights are, just press the plus or
00:01:12.920 --> 00:01:15.720
minus controls next to
the auto lamp controls.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg4.mp4
question: What is interior illumunations means?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side
to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg5.mp4
question: What three options for Start Duration can you choose between?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.673
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.673 --> 00:00:08.070
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a convenient feature that
00:00:08.070 --> 00:00:10.476
can help make maneuvering
a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.476 --> 00:00:12.640
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist and
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:15.831
there are a few steps you'll need
to do first in order to use it.
00:00:15.831 --> 00:00:17.290
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg1.mp4

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:00:28.130 --> 00:00:31.080
To raise or lower the seat,
pull up on the lever located on
00:00:31.080 --> 00:00:35.190
the side of the seat closest to the door
to raise it and press down to lower it.
00:00:36.770 --> 00:00:39.680
You can also change the angle
of the seatback by pulling up on
00:00:39.680 --> 00:00:41.980
the adjustment lever on
the side of the seatback.
00:00:41.980 --> 00:00:45.490
Leaning backward or forward to the desired
position and then releasing the lever.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg3.mp4

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:54.032 --> 00:00:56.484
If you want to change the factory
code to something that's easier for
00:00:56.484 --> 00:00:57.849
you to remember, you can do that too.
00:00:57.849 --> 00:00:58.848
[MUSIC]
00:00:58.848 --> 00:01:03.598
Just enter the factory code, press 1 2,
then enter your new code and
00:01:03.598 --> 00:01:07.478
your personal code will be
saved to position number one.
00:01:07.478 --> 00:01:10.699
If you're going to program
more than one code,
00:01:10.699 --> 00:01:14.725
press 1 2 after you entered
your first new code to save it,
00:01:14.725 --> 00:01:19.496
then enter a second personal code and
press3 4 to save it, and so on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg4.mp4
question: Can I have more than one code?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: Where are the jack handle and lug wrench located?

video_name: Charge Port Door Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-i03oHS_TMug
video_trans:
00:00:21.625 --> 00:00:22.345
To close it,
00:00:22.345 --> 00:00:26.609
press the indent tab firmly and it will
automatically rotate into position.
00:00:26.609 --> 00:00:29.641
You'll know it's locked when
you feel it latch into place.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Charge Port Door Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-i03oHS_TMug_seg3.mp4
question: How will the cover indicate it's locked?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the climate control power button located?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: How do you switch between normal and adaptive cruise control? What happens when you select normal?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: How is the regenerative energy saved and utilized by cars breaking system?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.522
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.522 --> 00:00:08.722
Your vehicle comes with a feature that
can help prevent you from accidentally
00:00:08.722 --> 00:00:13.030
shifting into reverse while shifting into
a forward gear on a manual transmission.
00:00:13.030 --> 00:00:15.280
It's called the reverse
lock-out pull ring.
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.330
Let me tell you about it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg1.mp4
question: what happens if you fail to come to a complete stop?

video_name: 8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc
video_trans:
00:00:19.970 --> 00:00:23.730
 To toggle through the different gauge
displays, use the up/down arrows, or
00:00:23.730 --> 00:00:27.080
the left/right arrows on the five-way
steering wheel controls.
00:00:27.080 --> 00:00:29.470
And press OK when you
get to your selection.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc_seg2.mp4
question: What is located on the five way steering controls?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg3.mp4
question: How do I set the alert mode to vibrate my steering wheel?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg4.mp4
question: how to access the charge port light preferences?

video_name: F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU
video_trans:
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:17.220
To extend the step from
its stowed position,
00:00:17.220 --> 00:00:19.820
simply press down on the release
with your foot here.
00:00:20.840 --> 00:00:24.100
To help avoid injury,
the box step has a slow release
00:00:24.100 --> 00:00:27.220
that prevents the step from
springing out too quickly.

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: How many sensitivity levels does the warning system have?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg4.mp4
question: What circumstance would the engine need to come on?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: What are the things we need to take care while driving back the trailer?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg3.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:30.320 --> 00:01:34.050
In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from.
00:01:34.050 --> 00:01:38.140
One bar, or the sportiest setting,
gets you the smallest gap.
00:01:38.140 --> 00:01:40.720
Two bars, which is the default gap.
00:01:40.720 --> 00:01:45.680
Three bars, or four, which is the comfort
setting and gives you the biggest gap.

available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
you’ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4
question: What does the park assist button look like?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: Can I add multiple trailer profiles?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:14.380 --> 00:00:16.190
It works a lot like
standard cruise control,
00:00:16.190 --> 00:00:19.196
in that it still maintains
your speed on flat roadways.
00:00:19.196 --> 00:00:21.470
But with ECO Cruise,
when you tap the brake, and
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.410
then want to resume your previously set
speed, it accelerates gradually to get
00:00:25.410 --> 00:00:29.100
your vehicle back up to speed and
that can help save energy.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.160
Be aware that you may experience some
speed loss when first going up hill but
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:37.110
after a short period of time,
it will catch up to your set speed.
00:00:37.110 --> 00:00:39.380
And if equipped with
adaptive cruise control,
00:00:39.380 --> 00:00:43.320
when your vehicle speed is slowed, it will
automatically accelerate again gradually
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:47.890
once traffic is cleared. That gradual
acceleration may make it seem as if your
00:00:47.890 --> 00:00:50.930
vehicle isn't keeping up with
the speed you've set, it is.
00:00:50.930 --> 00:00:53.710
It's just that its more efficient
to gradually accelerate.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg2.mp4
question: How does the driver assist feature work when referring to cruise control?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg4.mp4
question: When the gasoline engine turns on, is there a noticeable disruption within the cabin?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: What anchor should you attach first when securing a child safety seat?

Using the five-way controls on your

00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400

00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740

the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030

where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.

video_name: Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.603
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.603 --> 00:00:06.620
To help avoid damaging
your transmission and
00:00:06.620 --> 00:00:08.691
to help provide a better
driving experience,
00:00:08.691 --> 00:00:12.640
there are a few things you should know
about proper clutch pedal operation.
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.215
Let me explain.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:18.445
The manual transmission in your vehicle
has six gears along with a reverse gear.
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:22.265
When starting your vehicle, make sure that
your clutch pedal is fully depressed.
00:00:22.265 --> 00:00:25.575
In order for your transmission and
clutch to function at it's best,
00:00:25.575 --> 00:00:29.520
you need to press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor before every shift.
00:00:29.520 --> 00:00:32.440
Then slowly release it while
pressing the accelerator.
00:00:32.440 --> 00:00:35.280
Not pressing the clutch pedal fully
between shifts can damage your
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:40.780
transmission, and you may experience
a grinding sound, rapid jerking motion,
00:00:40.780 --> 00:00:44.400
or the car may stall if the clutch
is not properly engaged.
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:46.080
And here's another thing you should know.
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:48.920
Don't drive with your foot
resting on the clutch pedal, or
00:00:48.920 --> 00:00:52.230
use it to hold your vehicle at
a standstill while waiting on a hill.
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:55.670
Doing so may overheat the clutch and
prematurely wear it out.
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:58.548
This could nullify
a clutch warranty claim.
00:00:58.548 --> 00:00:59.583
Any questions?
00:00:59.583 --> 00:01:02.556
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:02.556 --> 00:01:12.556
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE_seg1.mp4
question: Where should the clutch be when I start the vehicle?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:25.550 --> 00:00:28.610
You'll know if your child's seat can
be used with the LATCH system if it has
00:00:28.610 --> 00:00:33.220
either two rigid attachments with metal
connectors, or two flexible straps
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.200
with metal hooks that can be connected
to the lower anchors in your seat.
00:00:37.200 --> 00:00:40.490
And if it has a belt strap with a metal
clip that's attached to the top back
00:00:40.490 --> 00:00:42.030
portion of the seat.
00:00:42.030 --> 00:00:43.180
Still with me?
00:00:43.180 --> 00:00:44.190
Great.

Adaptive cruise control helps keep
a preset distance when in cruise control,
00:01:31.757 --> 00:01:35.994
plus when used in conjunction with tow
haul mode, it will increase the follow
00:01:35.994 --> 00:01:39.921
distance slightly to compensate for
more braking distance if needed.

use the Brake Coach feature,
00:01:02.980 --> 00:01:05.170
you can disable it using
the five-way control.
00:01:05.170 --> 00:01:12.317
Going back to your Settings menu,
then Display, Brake Coach, and Off.

video_trans:

In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from.
00:01:34.050 --> 00:01:38.140
One bar, or the sportiest setting,
gets you the smallest gap.
00:01:38.140 --> 00:01:40.720
Two bars, which is the default gap.
00:01:40.720 --> 00:01:45.680
Three bars, or four, which is the comfort
setting and gives you the biggest gap.

video_trans:

To extend the step from
its stowed position,
00:00:17.220 --> 00:00:19.820
simply press down on the release
with your foot here.
00:00:20.840 --> 00:00:24.100
To help avoid injury,
the box step has a slow release
00:00:24.100 --> 00:00:27.220
that prevents the step from
springing out too quickly.

While you're in park, neutral, or drive,
press the camera button above the CD slot
00:00:32.560 --> 00:00:35.920
once to see either a front, normal view,
which gives you an image of
00:00:35.920 --> 00:00:39.620

00:00:39.620 --> 00:00:42.720

00:00:43.750 --> 00:00:46.900
That can be helpful, as it gives you added
visibility when you're pulling out of
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.450
a driveway, street, parking spot,
or while maneuvering.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg2.mp4
question: Can you have the air coming through a combination of vents?

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:10.860 --> 00:00:14.460
To turn EcoSelect on,
simply press the Eco button located
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:17.230
on the center console next
to the driver's seat.
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:21.480
Here, you'll know it's on when you see
this icon in your information display.
00:00:21.480 --> 00:00:24.780
When activated, this feature is
designed to enhance fuel economy
00:00:24.780 --> 00:00:27.570
with some trade-offs in vehicle
performance and comfort.
00:00:27.570 --> 00:00:30.360
You may notice that your climate
system takes a bit longer to heat or
00:00:30.360 --> 00:00:33.880
cool the cabin, while also
altering other vehicle features.
00:00:33.880 --> 00:00:38.030
You may also experience less aggressive
acceleration and increased deceleration
00:00:38.030 --> 00:00:41.700
while coasting, which helps recharge
the battery more efficiently.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI_seg2.mp4
question: What is the location of eco button?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg3.mp4
question: What type of graph does your fuel history show?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: What is the cause for smears on windshield?

Normal, which is the default mode, and
gives you an engaging driver experience
00:00:52.840 --> 00:00:55.210
with a comfortable, controlled ride and
confident handling.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg4.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430
To adjust the gap setting,
press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590
down arrows on your steering
wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
you’ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4
question: When can I activate the parallel park system?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:44.950 --> 00:00:48.607
In addition, your rear-view camera has
an enhancement that shows you an image of
00:00:48.607 --> 00:00:50.453
what's directly behind your vehicle.
00:00:50.453 --> 00:00:52.361
It's called Dynamic Hitch Assist and
00:00:52.361 --> 00:00:56.541
it has guidelines that can help you line up
your trailer when you're connecting it.
00:00:56.541 --> 00:01:00.271
The image appears in your center display
to help you maneuver when you're in
00:01:00.271 --> 00:01:04.710
reverse and to help you accurately
connect to your trailer without help.

And during warmer weather, reduce
the energy needed for air conditioning by

setting the cabin temperature
a little higher while driving and
00:01:12.784 --> 00:01:16.110

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the relay box located?

video_name: Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.259
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.259 --> 00:00:07.200
Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876
your vehicle to monitor and
provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350
a trailer that you're towing
are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850
Let me explain.
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0_seg1.mp4
question: What feature allows the vehicle to monitor and provide a warning if the tires of the trailer are significantly underinflated?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:57.110 --> 00:01:01.446
Compared to a four or five speed,
the six speed SelectShift transmission,
00:01:01.446 --> 00:01:06.121
gives you greater acceleration from a dead
stop, in first and second gear, while
00:01:06.121 --> 00:01:10.486
higher gears give you better efficiency
with lower RPMs at highway speeds.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg5.mp4

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: What will system do when no trailer information is detected?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:57.690 --> 00:01:00.630
To use it, first press the auto
button in the center of the knob.
00:01:01.690 --> 00:01:04.790
Then select the temperature you want
using the temperature control knob
00:01:04.790 --> 00:01:07.590
on the right side of your
climate control panel.
00:01:07.590 --> 00:01:10.940
The temperature will appear in
the center digital display.
00:01:10.940 --> 00:01:14.350
Now, each time you turn on your vehicle
with your climate control on or
00:01:14.350 --> 00:01:15.920
turn on the A/C control,
00:01:15.920 --> 00:01:18.690
the system will automatically adjust
to reach your set temperature.

When looking at the 360-degree view,
00:00:30.200 --> 00:00:33.180
you'll see dotted yellow lines
on each side of the vehicle.
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:36.690
These represent the keep-out zone and
let you know where the edges of your
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:40.290
mirror are in relation to what
you're seeing in the camera image.

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?
