question: What precautions you have to take while re-adjusting your head-lamps?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:02:18.170 --> 00:02:21.850
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:02:21.850 --> 00:02:25.340
The sticker acts as a target that
the trailer reverse guidance feature and
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:28.480
rear view camera use to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:29.640 --> 00:02:31.250
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:31.250 --> 00:02:33.830
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:33.830 --> 00:02:36.790
You'll want to place the sticker
within 7 to 22 inches from
00:02:36.790 --> 00:02:38.890
the center of the trailer hitch ball.
00:02:38.890 --> 00:02:42.696
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal surface, so
00:02:42.696 --> 00:02:46.573
the entire sticker is in the acceptable
zone invisible by the rearview camera.
00:02:46.573 --> 00:02:48.293
[MUSIC]
00:02:48.293 --> 00:02:50.430
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:50.430 --> 00:02:54.020
Once the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:54.020 --> 00:02:56.020
record several measurements.
00:02:56.020 --> 00:02:59.880
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:59.880 --> 00:03:01.720
the hitch ball, and write it down.
00:03:01.720 --> 00:03:06.130
Next, measure the horizontal distance
from the center of the hitch ball to
00:03:06.130 --> 00:03:07.746
the center of the sticker.
00:03:07.746 --> 00:03:11.870
And the distance from the rear view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:03:11.870 --> 00:03:15.218
Keep in mind, the location is
not dependent on a straight or
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:20.780
a frame type, but based on where a surface
is available that meets the requirements.
00:03:20.780 --> 00:03:24.740
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:03:24.740 --> 00:03:26.645
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:28.335 --> 00:03:30.685
If the trailer has two or more axles,
00:03:30.685 --> 00:03:34.680
measure to the center point
between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg4.mp4
question: Where do I put the trailer stickers?

video_trans:
00:01:19.241 --> 00:01:23.369
For the the rear tires,
place it under the rear axle, like this.

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:29.580 --> 00:00:31.031
To help power your upfit needs,
00:00:31.031 --> 00:00:34.630
we've increased the circuit capacity
over the previous generation.
00:00:34.630 --> 00:00:37.300
There are now four 25 amp circuits.
00:00:37.300 --> 00:00:42.010
Plus two 40 amp circuits which can be
configured to be hot at all times.
00:00:42.010 --> 00:00:43.890
So you don't need to have
the vehicle running for power.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg3.mp4

You can also see your towing status, as

00:00:34.670 --> 00:00:37.703
not your trailer is connected and

00:00:37.703 --> 00:00:40.790
You can also access gain,

00:00:40.790 --> 00:00:44.950
trailer information for

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: What do you get for your use after you fold both the seats down?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:40.420 --> 00:01:44.360
As you turn the wheel,
you'll see two zones, yellow and red.
00:01:44.360 --> 00:01:48.630
Yellow being a caution alert that warns
you of a potential jackknife position.
00:01:48.630 --> 00:01:52.160
And red signaling that you need to stop,
pull forward, and
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:55.610
put the truck and
trailer back into an inline position.
00:01:55.610 --> 00:01:59.550
One more thing, when using the Straight
Backup mode, a steering wheel graphic
00:01:59.550 --> 00:02:02.920
shows you which way to turn your steering
wheel to keep your trailer straight.
00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:05.060
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg5.mp4
question: What are the indications in yellow and red with trailer line up?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: Where does the pre-collision assist alert message appear?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg4.mp4
question: What occurs during tow haul mode?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:21.630 --> 00:01:24.440
To adjust the display screen brightness,
in other words,
00:01:24.440 --> 00:01:27.530
your touchscreen, touch the Display tile.
00:01:27.530 --> 00:01:32.120
From here, you can adjust the brightness,
change the mode to Auto,
00:01:32.120 --> 00:01:35.000
Day, Night or Off.
00:01:35.000 --> 00:01:39.500
If you've chosen Off, just touch your
screen anywhere to bring it back.
00:01:39.500 --> 00:01:41.680
You can also turn Auto Dim on,
00:01:41.680 --> 00:01:45.930
which allows the display screen to dim
when you adjust the interior lighting.

video_trans:
00:01:04.710 --> 00:01:07.320
Now, let me tell you about some of
the other trailering technology.
00:01:08.380 --> 00:01:12.240
A factory installed integrated trailer
brake controller synchronizes your truck
00:01:12.240 --> 00:01:14.820
brakes with the electric brakes
on your trailer for smoother and
00:01:14.820 --> 00:01:15.840
more effective braking.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:38.782 --> 00:02:43.168
Keep in mind, you can cancel adaptive cruise
control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965
pressing the cancel button on
the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489
the adaptive cruise control and allow you
to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.
 
00:02:56.790 --> 00:02:57.996
Any questions?
00:02:57.996 --> 00:02:59.971
Go to Owner.Ford.com.

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:43.760
If you turn the trailer to the right,
00:00:43.760 --> 00:00:47.240
you'll see the right side of your
vehicle and trailer and vice versa.
00:00:47.240 --> 00:00:51.480
You can switch views manually at
any time by using the arrow keys.
00:00:51.480 --> 00:00:57.820
Either full driver, partial driver, 50-50,
partial passenger or full passenger.
00:00:58.990 --> 00:01:01.740
Pressing the Camera icon takes
you to Normal Rear View,
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:05.160
which allows you to see your trailer hitch
or what is directly behind your truck.
00:01:06.850 --> 00:01:10.340
Pressing the Plus button zooms in,
pressing the Return or
00:01:10.340 --> 00:01:14.610
Back button takes you back to
the 360 degree camera system.
00:01:14.610 --> 00:01:16.650
And Auto returns you to
Automatic View Mode.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg3.mp4

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: What type of lights will flash when the vehicle detects an electrical connection?

video_trans:
00:01:22.280 --> 00:01:26.540
The towing display gives you information
on towing status like your steering angle,
00:01:26.540 --> 00:01:29.020
information on the specific
trailer that is attached,
00:01:29.020 --> 00:01:32.390
the amount of miles you have on
that trailer, trailer light status,
00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:35.470
trailer setup, and checklist to
follow when connecting your trailer.

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs_seg1.mp4
question: What option should you select in your information display to find Break Performance?

to help prevent locking the key fob inside

00:02:09.670 --> 00:02:13.120
indicating the fob has been left in

To open the storage compartment, just

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: Why is my engine not shutting off with auto start/stop?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:49.240 --> 00:00:51.890
Remote start is especially nice
when you want to cool off your
00:00:51.890 --> 00:00:53.670
car before getting in on a hot day.
00:00:54.880 --> 00:00:58.590
In fact, if your car has automatic
climate control it will actually
00:00:58.590 --> 00:01:02.520
gauge the temperature inside the car and
adjust it to a more comfortable setting.
00:01:02.520 --> 00:01:06.340
This means that your heated seats,
steering wheel, and
00:01:06.340 --> 00:01:10.090
defrost will turn on on colder days and
your air conditioning and
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:11.960
cooled seats will turn
on when it is warm out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg4.mp4
question: How does the automatic climate control work?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:01:34.090 --> 00:01:38.040
Of course, if you rather not use the
ECO Cruise feature it can be turned off
00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:41.265
using the five we controls on
the left side of the steering wheel.
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.130
And scroll into settings in
your information display.
00:01:44.130 --> 00:01:47.490
Drivers Assist ECO Cruise then off.
00:01:47.490 --> 00:01:51.140
When ECO Cruise has been turned off
the next time you set a cruising speed,
00:01:51.140 --> 00:01:52.724
you will be using standard cruise control.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg5.mp4
question: How can you turn off ECO Cruise?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: Why is it important to let the tires weatherize for 24 hours?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:57.030 --> 00:01:59.800
To lift the seat out of
the stowed position, squeeze and
00:01:59.800 --> 00:02:01.960
pull up on the handle as you lift.
00:02:01.960 --> 00:02:05.000
The seat will lift out of
the floor in a folded position.
00:02:05.000 --> 00:02:08.310
So just push it back to lock
it into the floor latches.
00:02:08.310 --> 00:02:13.038
Then, move your seat back into the upright
position by pulling strap number 1 and
00:02:13.038 --> 00:02:14.901
the long strap on the seat back.

video_name: Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.603
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.603 --> 00:00:06.620
To help avoid damaging
your transmission and
00:00:06.620 --> 00:00:08.691
to help provide a better
driving experience,
00:00:08.691 --> 00:00:12.640
there are a few things you should know
about proper clutch pedal operation.
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.215
Let me explain.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:18.445
The manual transmission in your vehicle
has six gears along with a reverse gear.
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:22.265
When starting your vehicle, make sure that
your clutch pedal is fully depressed.
00:00:22.265 --> 00:00:25.575
In order for your transmission and
clutch to function at it's best,
00:00:25.575 --> 00:00:29.520
you need to press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor before every shift.
00:00:29.520 --> 00:00:32.440
Then slowly release it while
pressing the accelerator.
00:00:32.440 --> 00:00:35.280
Not pressing the clutch pedal fully
between shifts can damage your
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:40.780
transmission, and you may experience
a grinding sound, rapid jerking motion,
00:00:40.780 --> 00:00:44.400
or the car may stall if the clutch
is not properly engaged.
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:46.080
And here's another thing you should know.
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:48.920
Don't drive with your foot
resting on the clutch pedal, or
00:00:48.920 --> 00:00:52.230
use it to hold your vehicle at
a standstill while waiting on a hill.
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:55.670
Doing so may overheat the clutch and
prematurely wear it out.
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:58.548
This could nullify
a clutch warranty claim.
00:00:58.548 --> 00:00:59.583
Any questions?
00:00:59.583 --> 00:01:02.556
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:02.556 --> 00:01:12.556
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE_seg1.mp4
question: How many gears does the manual transmission have?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg4.mp4
question: How do I change the default settings?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg6.mp4
question: What causes the window to be temporarily disabled?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:56.180 --> 00:01:58.840
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:02.180
To cool down your vehicle quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:02.180 --> 00:02:05.850
turn the nob toward the cool
setting to reduce the temperature.
00:02:05.850 --> 00:02:08.476
To warm your vehicle up quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:08.480 --> 00:02:11.160
turn your nob toward the warm
setting to increase it.
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.036
To quickly defrost the windshield and side
windows, press the Max defrost button.
00:02:16.036 --> 00:02:17.348
Both the temperature and
00:02:17.348 --> 00:02:21.070
fan speed will automatically
adjust to the highest settings.
00:02:21.070 --> 00:02:21.710
In mild or
00:02:21.710 --> 00:02:25.910
warm temperatures, you may notice
that your A/C automatically turns on.
00:02:25.910 --> 00:02:29.300
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg9.mp4

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How can I receive email updates on the Ford website?

video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.

when you're backing into a parking space.

question: What is the function of the active guidelines on the rear view camera display?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg1.mp4
question: What happens when you pull the strap located on the side of the seat back, closest to the door?

video_name: Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk
video_trans:
00:00:10.139 --> 00:00:14.473
Dynamic Hitch Assist is part of the rear
view camera system on your truck.
00:00:14.473 --> 00:00:17.767
It helps you line up the center of the
truck to your trailer from inside using
00:00:17.767 --> 00:00:20.606
a black dotted line that moves
when you move the steering wheel.
00:00:20.606 --> 00:00:24.800
The black line is displayed on
your eight inch LCD touchscreen.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:27.165
Because you can see the exact
angle of your truck and
00:00:27.165 --> 00:00:31.015
trailer the whole time you're backing up,
you can line up your truck's hitch with
00:00:31.015 --> 00:00:34.454
the trailer without a spotter and
without getting out of your truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk_seg2.mp4
question: where is this feature displayed?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.170
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.170 --> 00:00:08.600
Did you know that you can unlock your
car and start it without using a key?
00:00:08.600 --> 00:00:10.910
In fact,
with your key fob in your pocket or
00:00:10.910 --> 00:00:15.460
purse, you can unlock the doors, start
the ignition, and lock all of your doors.
00:00:15.460 --> 00:00:17.060
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg1.mp4
question: What is the function of the Locking and unlocking using Intelligent Access with push-button start feature?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.720
When you're ready to fold up the step,
00:00:45.720 --> 00:00:48.550
press the yellow number 1
button on the extender bar and
00:00:48.550 --> 00:00:51.200
guide it down with your hand to allow
it to lower into the black bar.
00:00:52.680 --> 00:00:57.140
Now, press the yellow number 2
button at the base of the bar, here.
00:00:57.140 --> 00:01:00.245
Fold the bar toward you and
push it back into the tailgate.
00:01:00.245 --> 00:01:02.985
Finally, lift the step up
until it's horizontal and
00:01:02.985 --> 00:01:05.045
push it back into
the tailgate until it clicks.
00:01:06.135 --> 00:01:07.080
One more thing.
00:01:07.080 --> 00:01:11.028
Unlike previous models, the tailgate
handle is stored within the tailgate
00:01:11.028 --> 00:01:14.556
itself, so it's flush to the surface and
nothing is sticking out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg3.mp4
question: How will I know when the tailgate step is locked in place?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: Where are the jack handle and lug wrench?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg7.mp4
question: How can you play the previous content ?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:14.355 --> 00:00:17.840
Let's start with BLIS or
Blind Spot Information System.
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:19.930
Any time you put your vehicle in drive and
00:00:19.930 --> 00:00:23.140
you are going faster than six
miles per hour BLIS will turn on.
00:00:23.140 --> 00:00:27.410
After that it's always active when
your vehicle is drive or neutral.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg2.mp4
question: What does the acronym BLIS stand for?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:43.090 --> 00:00:45.920
Gasoline range is the estimated
distance to empty
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.160
based on the fuel remaining in the tank.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg3.mp4
question: What is the meaning of Gasoline Range?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs_seg1.mp4
question: What does break performance measure?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.340 --> 00:00:04.161
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.161 --> 00:00:08.276
Your vehicle may have a convenient feature
that helps make getting items from
00:00:08.276 --> 00:00:10.184
the truck box easier from the side.
00:00:10.184 --> 00:00:12.439
It's called the Box Side Step.
00:00:12.439 --> 00:00:13.820
Let me show you how it works.

question: what does the box side step do?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: What is the difference between regular and adaptive cruise control?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.437 --> 00:00:03.554
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.554 --> 00:00:05.600
>> Why do people keep flashing
their headlamps at me?
00:00:06.850 --> 00:00:09.810
>> Why do my headlamps seem too
high when I'm towing my boat?
00:00:11.810 --> 00:00:13.705
>> Why am I having a hard
time seeing the road?
00:00:15.255 --> 00:00:17.945
>> If you're adding extra weight
to the rear of your vehicle,
00:00:17.945 --> 00:00:22.375
such as hauling a trailer or boat,
it may make your headlamps appear unlevel.
00:00:23.565 --> 00:00:26.220
And that might mean you'll
have to readjust them.
00:00:26.220 --> 00:00:27.370
I know what you're thinking.
00:00:27.370 --> 00:00:29.830
But don't worry, this won't be hard.

00:00:03.984 --> 00:00:07.619
Did you know that you can unlock
your doors and open your trunk or
00:00:07.619 --> 00:00:10.033
manual lift gate without a key or remote?
00:00:10.033 --> 00:00:14.721
With SecuriCode, you just enter a code

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:59.490 --> 00:02:02.630
To run a report,
press Run Vehicle Health Report Now.
00:02:03.800 --> 00:02:06.250
You'll then get a running
report confirmation message.
00:02:06.250 --> 00:02:10.490
The vehicle must've been running for
at least a minute before running a report.
00:02:11.660 --> 00:02:15.040
Once it's finished running the report,
you'll receive a text message letting you
00:02:15.040 --> 00:02:16.760
know that you can now
view it in your email.
00:02:17.810 --> 00:02:19.090
If there is a problem,
00:02:19.090 --> 00:02:22.810
you can access dealer information
from your email to scheduled service.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg6.mp4
question: How long must the vehicle run before running a report?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:18.590 --> 00:00:23.540
When you shift into reverse, the camera
automatically shows you a 360-degree
00:00:23.540 --> 00:00:25.480
view on the right side of the screen,
00:00:25.480 --> 00:00:28.090
as well as a rear view on
the left side of the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg2.mp4
question: What happens when you shift into reverse?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg9.mp4
question: How Tow/HAWL feature is useful for adaptive cruise control in case of trailers?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: Where will a red light show up in this case?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: How do you know if it is securely put back in place?

video_name: Slide-On-Rod Sun Visor _ Ford How-To _ Ford-8G2h0IrM51Y
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:05.194
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.194 --> 00:00:09.670
Your vehicle may have a convenient feature
that you'll find helpful on sunny days.
00:00:09.670 --> 00:00:13.960
It's called the slide on rod sun visor
extension, and it adds an extra few inches
00:00:13.960 --> 00:00:17.200
to your sun visor arm to help
block the sunlight better.
00:00:17.200 --> 00:00:18.960
It's easy to use.
00:00:18.960 --> 00:00:21.650
Just rotate the visor toward
your side window, and
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:23.610
pull it toward the rear
of the car to extend it.
00:00:24.730 --> 00:00:28.070
Then, push it back into
place to retract it.
00:00:28.070 --> 00:00:29.220
Any questions?
00:00:29.220 --> 00:00:30.742
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:30.742 --> 00:00:40.742
[MUSIC]

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:15.650 --> 00:00:19.640
Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg2.mp4

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:22.695 --> 00:02:26.390
Cross-traffic alert warns you
of moving cars coming from
00:02:26.390 --> 00:02:30.490
either side when you're in reverse or
backing up and gives you three warnings.
00:02:30.490 --> 00:02:34.740
A light on the corresponding
side view mirror, a chime, and
00:02:34.740 --> 00:02:36.670
a message in your message center.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg6.mp4

video_trans:

00:00:07.714 --> 00:00:10.584

as part of an effort to provide our
00:00:10.584 --> 00:00:13.938
customers with more information about
what happens with their vehicles,
00:00:13.938 --> 00:00:17.030

health report feature.

As a matter of fact, in addition to being

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: What is the cross-traffic alert?

00:01:26.507 --> 00:01:28.385

00:01:28.385 --> 00:01:33.193
To turn it on, use the same button you
used to turn on the box interior lights.
00:01:33.193 --> 00:01:34.274
Any questions?

video_name: Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.216
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.216 --> 00:00:06.520
Did you know that your vehicle can
sense when something is behind you?
00:00:06.520 --> 00:00:10.020
It can, thanks to an available
reverse sensing system.
00:00:10.020 --> 00:00:11.940
Let me show you how it works.
00:00:11.940 --> 00:00:16.397
If your vehicle is in reverse, like when
you're backing out of or into a parking
00:00:16.397 --> 00:00:20.454
spot or garage, the reverse sensing
uses sensors on the rear bumpers and
00:00:20.454 --> 00:00:23.804
a warning sound to let you know
if something's behind you.
00:00:23.804 --> 00:00:27.069
If you have both forward and
reverse sensing, sensors on the front and
00:00:27.069 --> 00:00:30.450
back of your vehicle will detect
objects when you're in reverse.
00:00:30.450 --> 00:00:33.392
This is really helpful when you're
parallel parking since your front bumper
00:00:33.392 --> 00:00:34.669
swings when you're backing up.
00:00:34.669 --> 00:00:36.614
[MUSIC]
00:00:36.614 --> 00:00:41.960
And one more thing, the sensors have to be
clear of snow, ice, or mud to work right.
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:46.220
So make sure to check them periodically
and be aware that outside conditions or
00:00:46.220 --> 00:00:48.690
noises may also trigger the system.
00:00:48.690 --> 00:00:49.800
Any questions?
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:51.377
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:51.377 --> 00:01:01.377
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0_seg1.mp4
question: What do the sensors have to be clear of to work properly?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:52.902 --> 00:01:56.464
The stop and go feature comes in handy
while driving on the highway and
00:01:56.464 --> 00:01:57.947
heavy traffic conditions.
00:01:57.947 --> 00:02:00.656
If the vehicle ahead of
you comes to a stop your
00:02:00.656 --> 00:02:03.093
vehicle will also follow down to a stop.
00:02:03.093 --> 00:02:07.718
Once the lead vehicle begins moving within
a short period of about three seconds,
00:02:07.718 --> 00:02:10.346
your car will automatically
begin to follow.
00:02:10.346 --> 00:02:14.312
If it takes longer to move, you can press
the resume button on your steering wheel.
00:02:14.312 --> 00:02:18.866
Or tap the accelerator pedal to start
following the lead vehicle again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg8.mp4

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: How to improve the performance of the windshield wiper?

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: WHat is inflatable rear safety belts?

video_trans:

fold your entire seat forward for
00:01:08.790 --> 00:01:10.720

00:01:10.720 --> 00:01:14.840
pull the handle up all the way until
the seat releases from the floor.
00:01:14.840 --> 00:01:18.350
Then flip the whole seat forward by
grabbing the bottom and pushing it up.

00:00:27.500 --> 00:00:29.065
Using your heated mirrors is simple.
00:00:29.065 --> 00:00:30.033
[MUSIC]
00:00:30.033 --> 00:00:34.330
When you turn on your rear defrost,
your heated mirrors will turn on too.
00:00:34.330 --> 00:00:37.460
Keep in mind, if you have an auto
dimming driver's side mirror,
00:00:37.460 --> 00:00:40.520
it will take longer to defrost
because of the thicker glass.
00:00:40.520 --> 00:00:44.100
Any questions,
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Heated Mirrors _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DOQi4JZSeRQ_seg2.mp4
question: how does this feature works?

video_trans:

Another convienient feature
is that you get automatic
00:01:34.860 --> 00:01:36.640
updates via Wi-Fi with SYNC 3.
00:01:36.640 --> 00:01:41.380
Now you can easily update your SYNC
software when a new version is available.

video_trans:

Circles are shown to help gauge
the power being used by each component.
00:01:06.560 --> 00:01:10.090
The bigger the circle,
the more power that's being used.

question: Do circles increase in size when a higher amount of power is used?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw_seg3.mp4
question: How do you stop your windows from closing using the keyfob?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: What speed of the moving traffic activates the warning signal?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: What must be unobstructed for the system to operate properly?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg5.mp4
question: What does one solid bar and one pulsing bar on the charge port light indicate?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg4.mp4
question: what is the option 'limited' in the charge port light settings?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs_seg1.mp4
question: how to turn ON the brake performance feature?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: What lets you switch between outside air and air circulated within the vehicle?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:45.740 --> 00:00:49.720
Also new to SYNC 3 is simplified
voice commands, that make controlling
00:00:49.720 --> 00:00:53.700
certain features quick and easy without
having to go through multiple steps.
00:00:53.700 --> 00:00:56.390
For instance,
if you're listening to the radio and
00:00:56.390 --> 00:01:00.070
want to change to listening to your
media device, use the voice button and
00:01:00.070 --> 00:01:03.320
say, play song I am alive, for example.
00:01:03.320 --> 00:01:04.590
It's that easy.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg3.mp4
question: How do you get Sirius to play a song from a media device?

video_name: Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0
video_trans:
00:00:47.945 --> 00:00:52.325
For added convenience, there's also a LED
cargo light to help illuminate the rear
00:00:52.325 --> 00:00:54.570
area when hitching a trailer at night.
00:00:54.570 --> 00:00:58.196
Just press the button located to
the left of the headlamp control, here,
00:00:58.196 --> 00:00:58.906
to turn it on.
00:00:58.906 --> 00:01:03.220
Or the light button located
in the rear box, here.

WEBVTT

00:00:04.365 --> 00:00:08.200
Did you know your vehicle has up
to four auxiliary power points?
00:00:08.200 --> 00:00:12.980
That means you can plug in a computer,
phone, or tablet at the same time.

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg6.mp4

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:14.290
First, let's talk about the accelerometer.
00:00:14.290 --> 00:00:16.080
It's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:16.080 --> 00:00:19.410
Using the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel,
00:00:19.410 --> 00:00:21.410
select Track Apps in the Main Menu.
00:00:21.410 --> 00:00:23.822
Accelerometer, and press OK.
00:00:23.822 --> 00:00:27.630
The accelerometer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration, or
00:00:27.630 --> 00:00:30.672
deceleration on a virtual
gauge in the cluster, here.
00:00:30.672 --> 00:00:34.035
A red indicator dot in the center of
the gauge indicates the vehicle's
00:00:34.035 --> 00:00:37.630
longitudinal, and
latitudinal acceleration in real time.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:39.720
And updates it constantly.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.110
The numbers on the outside of the ring
represent the maximum accelerations
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:44.580
since the last reset values.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg2.mp4
question: What should you choose in the Main Menu to access the Accelerometer?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:31.040 --> 00:02:34.300
You can also input preset channels for
quick selection.
00:02:34.300 --> 00:02:37.362
To do so, tune to the channel
you wish to save, then touch and
00:02:37.362 --> 00:02:39.360
hold one of the memory preset buttons.
00:02:39.360 --> 00:02:44.420
The sound will mute for a brief moment
before resuming when the channel is saved.
00:02:44.420 --> 00:02:48.730
To add or view additional preset channels,
just touch the preset button.
00:02:48.730 --> 00:02:53.960
You can save up to 18 Sirius XM channels
with the three sets of presets.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg8.mp4
question: How can you input preset channels?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:57.690 --> 00:01:00.630
To use it, first press the auto
button in the center of the knob.
00:01:01.690 --> 00:01:04.790
Then select the temperature you want
using the temperature control knob
00:01:04.790 --> 00:01:07.590
on the right side of your
climate control panel.
00:01:07.590 --> 00:01:10.940
The temperature will appear in
the center digital display.
00:01:10.940 --> 00:01:14.350
Now, each time you turn on your vehicle
with your climate control on or
00:01:14.350 --> 00:01:15.920
turn on the A/C control,
00:01:15.920 --> 00:01:18.690
the system will automatically adjust
to reach your set temperature.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg4.mp4

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: What is the first step to replace 12-volt battery?

video_name: Explorer Trailer Hitch Cover Removal _ Ford How-To _ Ford-83YuRtOT7_Q
video_trans:
00:00:33.290 --> 00:00:38.660
To replace the panel, insert the four
top tabs first, and gently push it in.
00:00:38.660 --> 00:00:42.690
Next, push the bottom in until
you hear it snap into place.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Explorer Trailer Hitch Cover Removal _ Ford How-To _ Ford-83YuRtOT7_Q_seg3.mp4
question: What are the methods to replace the panel?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:54.600 --> 00:00:56.900
Keep in mind stones, rocks, and
00:00:56.900 --> 00:01:01.420
dirt can create tiny pits on your
chrome bumper resulting in rust spots.
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:05.320
If you notice rust spots appearing on your
bumper use a chrome polish to help remove
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710
the spots, maintain the luster, and
prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg3.mp4
question: What type of polish removes rust spots on bumpers?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: Do I need to come to a complete stop before reversing?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.512
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.512 --> 00:00:08.350
Your vehicle may be equipped with some or
all of these LED lighting features,
00:00:08.350 --> 00:00:12.610
that are both convenient and offer
a little extra security when traveling.
00:00:12.610 --> 00:00:13.270
Let me explain.
00:00:14.320 --> 00:00:17.450
Our quad beam LED head lamps
generate a brighter light,
00:00:17.450 --> 00:00:21.160
that resembles natural daylight,
which in turn can help reduce eye strain.
00:00:21.160 --> 00:00:24.425
Plus, they typically
last longer than halogen.
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:25.631
Bright LED tail lamps and
00:00:25.631 --> 00:00:30.130
fog lamps compliment the headlamps
while enhancing nighttime visibility.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg1.mp4
question: What is the purpose of the LED headlamps?

video_trans:

There's also Off Road Status which shows
you steering angle, pitch and roll, and
00:01:50.070 --> 00:01:51.770
your power distribution.

To adjust the recline of
the second row seat backs,

pull up on the handle on the side
of the seat closest to the door.
00:00:52.610 --> 00:00:56.180
And push the seat back back for
a greater recline, or forward for
00:00:56.180 --> 00:00:57.560

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:26.800
Here are few simple steps you'll
need to know when using them.
00:00:26.800 --> 00:00:31.170
If you want to use auto lamp, turn the
control knob to the auto lamp position.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:35.355
Your head lamps will come on automatically
as needed and will stay on for
00:00:35.355 --> 00:00:38.005
a while even after you
switch the ignition off.

video_trans:
00:01:57.030 --> 00:01:59.800
To lift the seat out of
the stowed position, squeeze and
00:01:59.800 --> 00:02:01.960
pull up on the handle as you lift.
00:02:01.960 --> 00:02:05.000
The seat will lift out of
the floor in a folded position.
00:02:05.000 --> 00:02:08.310
So just push it back to lock
it into the floor latches.
00:02:08.310 --> 00:02:13.038
Then, move your seat back into the upright
position by pulling strap number 1 and
00:02:13.038 --> 00:02:14.901
the long strap on the seat back.

For more feature settings,
swipe left on the touch screen.

Touching Vehicle enables you to set your
camera settings, warning chimes, and

video_trans:

And Snow/Wet,
which gives you confident handling and
00:01:25.080 --> 00:01:28.870
a direct connection to the road in wet,
or snowy weather conditions.
00:01:28.870 --> 00:01:32.280
Keep in mind, the selectable driving
modes have diagnostic checks
00:01:32.280 --> 00:01:36.380
that continuously monitor the system
to ensure proper operation.

There's also a small white car icon in the

00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.680
It lets you know which camera view is
being used, for example, 360 view,
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:56.840
split view, etc..

The icon highlights will change when

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
you’ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4
question: What will happen when an appropriate parking space in found?

video_name: Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0
video_trans:
00:00:09.970 --> 00:00:11.860
For starters,
there's a storage compartment for
00:00:11.860 --> 00:00:14.215
your sunglasses just to
the left of the steering wheel.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:17.339
To open it, just push in on the door,
then pull it open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0_seg2.mp4
question: Where are the storage compartments?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: What does auto start/stop do?

The Miles/Full
Charge screen is located

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: How do you use launch control?

video_trans:
00:00:22.160 --> 00:00:26.190
Vehicles equipped with Sirius XM
come with a pre-activated six month
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:31.020
all access trial subscription, which
includes Sirius XM radio for your vehicle,
00:00:31.020 --> 00:00:36.450
plus the ability to enjoy Sirius XM while

00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:38.130
on the Sirius XM app.
00:00:38.130 --> 00:00:41.070
Keep in mind,
in order to stream Sirius XM,
00:00:41.070 --> 00:00:45.250
you'll need to set up your account
with a username and password online.

video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side
to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:14.355 --> 00:00:17.840
Let's start with BLIS or
Blind Spot Information System.
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:19.930
Any time you put your vehicle in drive and
00:00:19.930 --> 00:00:23.140
you are going faster than six
miles per hour BLIS will turn on.
00:00:23.140 --> 00:00:27.410
After that it's always active when
your vehicle is drive or neutral.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg2.mp4

video_trans:

If you'd rather control your airflow
manually, adjust the fan speed or
00:01:23.840 --> 00:01:26.110
press any air distribution
button to turn it off.

Then select the temperature you want,
the air distribution you want,
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:35.960
A/C on or off, and to recirculate air.

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg2.mp4
question: How to access the vehicle jack?

video_trans:
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:21.010
To start, go to the Settings
menu on the touch screen.
00:00:21.010 --> 00:00:23.690
It's the one that looks like gears, here.
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:27.230
From here, you could personalize
several of your SYNC 3 features.
00:00:27.230 --> 00:00:31.040
You can set the clock by touching the
Clock tile as well as set automatic time
00:00:31.040 --> 00:00:34.790
zone updates, which adjusts the clock to
match the time zone you're driving in.
