video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg8.mp4
question: What is the function of the trailer sway control system?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: How long should i wait to reintall the tires to my vehicle?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]

video_trans:

If you're not sure what type of
lights you have, look for the VOL or
00:00:53.530 --> 00:00:54.730

00:00:55.900 --> 00:00:59.960
If you have HID lamps, you'll want
the top of the beam to be about two
00:00:59.960 --> 00:01:01.800

00:01:01.800 --> 00:01:07.080
If you have halogen lamps, the top of the
beam should be right on your tape mark.

Still with me?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en

[MUSIC]
00:00:05.282 --> 00:00:08.780
Why do I see my gears sometimes but
not others?
00:00:08.780 --> 00:00:11.710
Did you know that your automatic
transmission may let you manually
00:00:11.710 --> 00:00:13.350
switch gears too?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:17.240
In fact, with SelectShift,
not only can you easily shift gears,
00:00:17.240 --> 00:00:19.780
you don't have to worry
about using a clutch either.
00:00:19.780 --> 00:00:20.990
Here's how it works.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg1.mp4

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
00:00:26.130 --> 00:00:29.690
During cold and hot weather,
you'll see reduced electric range.
00:00:29.690 --> 00:00:33.220
To help minimize this loss in
range in cold weather conditions,
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.280
use the heated seats, and set your climate
control temperature and fan speed lower
00:00:37.280 --> 00:00:40.870
to help lessen the energy needed for
the high voltage electric heater.
00:00:40.870 --> 00:00:44.010
And for electric only vehicles,
specifically, keeping your vehicle
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.670
plugged in whenever possible will help
maintain the battery temperature.
00:00:47.670 --> 00:00:51.580
It's also recommended that you
pre-heat your cabin while plugged in.
00:00:51.580 --> 00:00:53.640
You can do so through your touchscreen or
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.633
through MyFord Mobile by setting your
planned departure time or go time and
00:00:57.633 --> 00:01:02.180
your desired cabin temperature so that the
system uses the energy from your home or
00:01:02.180 --> 00:01:05.880
charging station, instead of your
vehicle's high voltage battery.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg2.mp4
question: What will help maintain the battery temperature of an electrical only vehicle?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:54.660 --> 00:00:58.290
Active Park Assist can also help you get
out of a tight parallel parking space,
00:00:58.290 --> 00:01:01.080
which is great if someone is parked
too close in front of or behind you.
00:01:02.190 --> 00:01:05.320
Just press the same active park
assist button you used to park.
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:08.410
Let go of the steering wheel then
simply follow the prompts displayed on
00:01:08.410 --> 00:01:09.370
your screen.
00:01:09.370 --> 00:01:12.750
Once again you just accelerate,
shift, and brake as needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg3.mp4
question: What must be in front of you for the active assist park feature to work?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: What are differences between summer tyres and all season tyres?

video_name: Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.263
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.263 --> 00:00:07.204
You may be interested to know that
your vehicle may be equipped with
00:00:07.204 --> 00:00:11.430
a feature to enhance its performance when
driven on hilly and mountainous roads.
00:00:11.430 --> 00:00:12.750
Let me explain.
00:00:12.750 --> 00:00:15.200
It's called Sport Mode,
and when activated,
00:00:15.200 --> 00:00:19.140
the transmission extends the duration
between shifts of the lower gears.
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:23.170
So the engine stays in the sweet spot
of the engine's RPM power band for
00:00:23.170 --> 00:00:25.580
a more spirited throttle response.
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:27.350
So instead of constant up and
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.420
down gear shifts, the transmission
holds a specific gear longer for
00:00:31.420 --> 00:00:35.720
peak performance when driving on twisty,
rolling roads with a steep grade.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro_seg1.mp4
question: How can my cars preform better on twisting or hilly roads?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: How the adaptive steering help in higher speeds?

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:10.860 --> 00:00:14.460
To turn EcoSelect on,
simply press the Eco button located
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:17.230
on the center console next
to the driver's seat.
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:21.480
Here, you'll know it's on when you see
this icon in your information display.
00:00:21.480 --> 00:00:24.780
When activated, this feature is
designed to enhance fuel economy
00:00:24.780 --> 00:00:27.570
with some trade-offs in vehicle
performance and comfort.
00:00:27.570 --> 00:00:30.360
You may notice that your climate
system takes a bit longer to heat or
00:00:30.360 --> 00:00:33.880
cool the cabin, while also
altering other vehicle features.
00:00:33.880 --> 00:00:38.030
You may also experience less aggressive
acceleration and increased deceleration
00:00:38.030 --> 00:00:41.700
while coasting, which helps recharge
the battery more efficiently.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI_seg2.mp4
question: What does the Eco-Select feature do?

00:00:31.031 --> 00:00:34.630
we've increased the circuit capacity
over the previous generation.
00:00:34.630 --> 00:00:37.300
There are now four 25 amp circuits.
00:00:37.300 --> 00:00:42.010
Plus two 40 amp circuits which can be

00:00:42.010 --> 00:00:43.890
So you don't need to have

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: What are some limitations about the auto start/stop?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: Where are the anchor points?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: Do I have to come to a complete stop before shifting with a manual transmission?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: what is regenerative braking and what is its use?

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:09.330 --> 00:00:13.670
Let me explain. Selectable Driving Mode
instantly modifies the electronic
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:17.230
stability control system and traction
control, which help maintain your vehicle's
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:20.170
command of the road in poor conditions,
or high performance driving.
00:00:21.280 --> 00:00:24.220
It also enhances throttle response for
quick acceleration,
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:29.170
crisper transmission shift points,
and finally steering effort and feel.
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:32.270
Together the selectable driving
mounts automatically tailor your
00:00:32.270 --> 00:00:35.290

the mode you've selected.

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:01:09.170 --> 00:01:13.070
To manually shift gears,
move your gear shift from D to M.
00:01:13.070 --> 00:01:15.820
Now, only your current gear will appear.
00:01:15.820 --> 00:01:19.590
And you can use the plus button to up
shift and the minus to down shift.
00:01:19.590 --> 00:01:23.690
Keep in mind, even though you're manually
changing gears, SelectShift will prevent
00:01:23.690 --> 00:01:28.510
some shifts if your engine speed is
too high or if your RPMs are too low.
00:01:28.510 --> 00:01:32.710
And if you come to a stop while in Manual
Mode, the transmission will automatically
00:01:32.710 --> 00:01:36.600
downshift to a lower gear for
easier acceleration when you drive away.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg4.mp4
question: What button allows drivers to downshift?

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.

00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280

00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870

00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: How do you know that Auto Start Stop is activated?

00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg3.mp4
question: What has been added to the vehicle to compensate for numerous start ups?

switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.219
go to the Settings tab on your
8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:26.219 --> 00:00:30.320
Scroll to Advanced Settings >
Vehicle > Power Running Boards.

use the Brake Coach feature,
00:01:02.980 --> 00:01:05.170
you can disable it using
the five-way control.
00:01:05.170 --> 00:01:12.317
Going back to your Settings menu,
then Display, Brake Coach, and Off.

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: How can I fold down the rear seat backs in my vehicle?

To help protect against fuel theft,
splashing, or

water from leaking in when it rains or

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: What does the lane keeping system do?

video_trans:
00:01:00.588 --> 00:01:05.024
High visibility LED box lights in the box
interior make it easy to find and
00:01:05.024 --> 00:01:07.350
load items in the dark.
00:01:07.350 --> 00:01:11.020
There are two lights located in
the rear corners that shine forward.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:14.770
There is also one in the high mounted
stop lamp on the rear of the cab.
00:01:14.770 --> 00:01:19.780
To turn them on and off from inside the
cab, just press the box lighting button, here.
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:22.760
After ten minutes they
will turn off gradually.

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: What happens when the measurements are confirmed?

video_trans:

A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150
while an amber bar indicates
a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: How do you remove the relay cover?

video_trans:

Kind: captions
Language: en

00:00:04.536 --> 00:00:08.538
DId you know that your plug-in hybrid electric
vehicle is equipped with a feature that
00:00:08.538 --> 00:00:12.543
gives you an approximate estimate of how
far you can travel and how much fuel or
00:00:12.543 --> 00:00:14.460

The vehicle range indicator

00:00:22.210 --> 00:00:25.240
The range is displayed at

00:00:25.240 --> 00:00:29.510
With gasoline ranges shown in white and
electric range in blue.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: What causes auto-start stop not to work?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg3.mp4

video_trans:
00:01:09.286 --> 00:01:12.334
The trailer tire pressure
monitoring system, or TPMS,
00:01:12.334 --> 00:01:16.778
displays the individual tire pressure of
a connected trailer and provides an alert
00:01:16.778 --> 00:01:21.304
message in your instrument cluster if one or more is significantly under inflated
00:01:21.304 --> 00:01:22.244
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg4.mp4
question: What system displays the individual tire pressure of a connected trailer?

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425
select gears.
00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E_seg3.mp4
question: What symbol do you push on the gearshift to downshift?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:19.660 --> 00:01:24.240
Your vehicle may also have an automatic
Dual-Zone temperature control system.
00:01:24.240 --> 00:01:28.040
It lets the driver and front
passenger set different temperatures.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg6.mp4
question: Can the passengers and driver be set different temperatures?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:06.870
Track provides more of
a performance driving experience
00:01:06.870 --> 00:01:10.650
as the engine responds directly to your
input, and takes on a more powerful tone.
00:01:10.650 --> 00:01:15.280
When you're in track mode a performance
oriented advance track calibration
00:01:15.280 --> 00:01:17.020
is automatically selected.
00:01:17.020 --> 00:01:21.110
And the usual advance track intervention
is reduced and tunes specifically for
00:01:21.110 --> 00:01:22.550
race track usage.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg6.mp4
question: what is not recommended for normal roads?

video_name: Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY
video_trans:
00:00:23.260 --> 00:00:26.534
The Power Points will stay powered
after you've turned off your ignition.
00:00:26.534 --> 00:00:29.224
So, that you can keep charging
your devices even after you've
00:00:29.224 --> 00:00:30.094
left your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY_seg3.mp4
question: can the power points stay powered after turning off the ignition?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:39.921 --> 00:01:44.632
Adaptive steering helps reduce under steer
at higher speeds, while allowing the front
00:01:44.660 --> 00:01:48.720
wheels to turn fully with fewer turns
of the steering wheel at lower speeds.
00:01:48.720 --> 00:01:51.640
And when used with tow haul
the vehicle delays upshifts and
00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359
provides engine breaking when descending
hilly roads with heavy loads.
00:01:55.359 --> 00:01:56.568
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg7.mp4
question: How does adaptive steering aide with tow haul?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:28.690
If you have rain-sensing front wipers,
move the stalk up to the first position.
00:00:28.690 --> 00:00:32.790
You can change their speed or sensitivity
by turning the inner-ring up or down.
00:00:33.920 --> 00:00:35.900
If you don't have
the rain-sensing feature,
00:00:35.900 --> 00:00:38.860
the ring controls the delay between wipes.
00:00:38.860 --> 00:00:40.830
And if you just don't
want to use the feature,
00:00:40.830 --> 00:00:44.400
you can always choose between normal and
fast wipes.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg2.mp4
question: How can the wiper speed and sensitivity be altered?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: What is the miles per hour I need to drive to get the cailbration message?

One more thing: vehicles equipped with
EcoSelect will also get the benefits of
00:00:45.715 --> 00:00:49.360
EcoCruise, which helps maximize economy

00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.974
where the vehicle may temporarily lose a

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg1.mp4
question: How to fold up or remove the 2nd-row folding seats?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the jackhandle located?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:16.650 --> 00:01:20.350
Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg4.mp4
question: What helps us to reverse the car's trailer easily?

To close your window all the way,
firmly pull up on the switch and let go.

To close it part way,
pull up lightly and let go.

To open your window all the way,

video_trans:

Compared to a four or five speed,
the six speed SelectShift transmission,
00:01:01.446 --> 00:01:06.121
gives you greater acceleration from a dead
stop, in first and second gear, while
00:01:06.121 --> 00:01:10.486
higher gears give you better efficiency
with lower RPMs at highway speeds.

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:54.600 --> 00:00:56.900
Keep in mind stones, rocks, and
00:00:56.900 --> 00:01:01.420
dirt can create tiny pits on your
chrome bumper resulting in rust spots.
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:05.320
If you notice rust spots appearing on your
bumper use a chrome polish to help remove
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710
the spots, maintain the luster, and
prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:54.288
To heat your car up and defrost
the windshield and side windows quickly,
00:01:54.288 --> 00:01:58.296
adjust the temperature control to your
desired setting or select max defrost.
00:01:58.296 --> 00:02:01.446
This will automatically turn your
air distribution to defrost,
00:02:01.446 --> 00:02:06.180
set the temperature to the hottest level
and the air flow to the maximum setting.
00:02:06.180 --> 00:02:10.650
In mild or warm temperatures you may
notice that your A/C also turns on.
00:02:10.650 --> 00:02:13.320
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg7.mp4

video_trans:

And during warmer weather, reduce
the energy needed for air conditioning by
00:01:09.651 --> 00:01:12.784
setting the cabin temperature
a little higher while driving and
00:01:12.784 --> 00:01:16.110
use the Go Time feature to pre-cool
your vehicle while plugged in.
00:01:16.110 --> 00:01:17.294
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg3.mp4

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: what does cross traffic alert do?

video_trans:

To close it, you can kick your leg under
the bumper again, or simply push the lift
00:00:29.540 --> 00:00:33.700
gate close button located on
the bottom of the lift gate, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg3.mp4

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:14.290
First, let's talk about the accelerometer.
00:00:14.290 --> 00:00:16.080
It's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:16.080 --> 00:00:19.410
Using the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel,
00:00:19.410 --> 00:00:21.410
select Track Apps in the Main Menu.
00:00:21.410 --> 00:00:23.822
Accelerometer, and press OK.
00:00:23.822 --> 00:00:27.630
The accelerometer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration, or
00:00:27.630 --> 00:00:30.672
deceleration on a virtual
gauge in the cluster, here.
00:00:30.672 --> 00:00:34.035
A red indicator dot in the center of
the gauge indicates the vehicle's
00:00:34.035 --> 00:00:37.630
longitudinal, and
latitudinal acceleration in real time.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:39.720
And updates it constantly.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.110
The numbers on the outside of the ring
represent the maximum accelerations
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:44.580
since the last reset values.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg2.mp4
question: What does the accelerometer tell you?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:37.500
With your gear shift lever in D,
00:00:37.500 --> 00:00:41.000
press the minus button to activate
progressive range selection.
00:00:41.000 --> 00:00:43.490
When you do,
you'll see the available gears
00:00:43.490 --> 00:00:47.150
as well as the current gear
indicated on the instrument cluster.
00:00:47.150 --> 00:00:51.350
So, if you press the minus button once,
it will lock out sixth gear.
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:54.230
And press it again to lock out fifth,
and so on.
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.640
Once you lock out gears,
only the available gears will be shown and
00:00:57.640 --> 00:00:59.960
your transmission will
automatically shift between them.
00:01:01.000 --> 00:01:03.950
The unlocked gears will automatically
reappear in the display
00:01:03.950 --> 00:01:05.070
when you restart your vehicle.
00:01:06.580 --> 00:01:09.170
To unlock a gear,
just press the plus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg3.mp4
question: How do I activate progressive range selection?

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.740
If equipped with a diesel engine,
the lower door is available for
00:00:39.740 --> 00:00:42.260
adding diesel exhaust fluid only.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg2.mp4
question: Where do I put the diesel exhaust fluid?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:00:42.860 --> 00:00:46.486
However, if your light flashes rapidly and
then turns to a constant light,
00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899
[MUSIC]
00:00:50.899 --> 00:00:52.750
Don't worry, I'll walk you through them.
00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032
You'll need to complete the next
few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542
you might want to have someone help
you if you think it would be easier.
00:00:57.542 --> 00:00:59.260
[MUSIC]
00:00:59.260 --> 00:01:03.500
First, press and hold the learn button
on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg2.mp4
question: How much time to I have to complete the remaining steps if the light flashes rapidly and then becomes constant?

video_name: Charge Port Door Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-i03oHS_TMug
video_trans:
00:00:15.175 --> 00:00:19.395
To open the charge port door,
just press the indent tab, here, and
00:00:19.395 --> 00:00:21.625
it will automatically spring open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Charge Port Door Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-i03oHS_TMug_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the charge port door located on my electric vehicle?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:02.720 --> 00:01:06.560
Circles are shown to help gauge
the power being used by each component.
00:01:06.560 --> 00:01:10.090
The bigger the circle,
the more power that's being used.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg3.mp4
question: What does the circles mean on the power flow status screen?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg3.mp4
question: How does ECO cruise work?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: Which mirror lights up when a car is on your left?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:14.240 --> 00:00:17.820
First, press the on off switch on
the end of the left hand stock
00:00:17.820 --> 00:00:18.820
to turn lane keeping on.
00:00:20.540 --> 00:00:24.560
Once it's on, use the five way control
on the left side of your steering wheel
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:25.900
to choose your settings.
00:00:25.900 --> 00:00:28.330
Select Driver Assist, then Lane Keeping.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg2.mp4
question: What is the name of the selection, in settings, right before lane keeping called?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:23.520 --> 00:00:27.080
To get to the screen, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel and
00:00:27.080 --> 00:00:33.070
scroll to Engage, Empower, MyView,
and then Miles/Full Charge.
00:00:33.070 --> 00:00:36.730
This screen will also show up when
you select EV Now mode using the EV
00:00:36.730 --> 00:00:37.640
button here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg3.mp4
question: What is the function of EV button?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:26.970 --> 00:00:27.820
Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740
First, you'll need to
access programming mode.
00:00:36.740 --> 00:00:37.316
Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015
[MUSIC]
00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg3.mp4
question: how do you access programming?

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg5.mp4
question: What tool do you need to adjust your lights?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:01:20.190 --> 00:01:23.630
Keep in mind, if your transmitter stops
working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380
release the transmitter every two seconds.
00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.
00:01:34.590 --> 00:01:35.175
Still with me?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg4.mp4
question: What does the blinking of the indicator light mean?

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:42.240
To measure where your lamp should be
aimed, you'll want to measure from
00:00:42.240 --> 00:00:45.230
the ground to the little mark
at the center of the lamp, here.
00:00:46.850 --> 00:00:48.740
Place tape on the wall
at that same height.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg3.mp4
question: How can find the hight the lamp should be aimed?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:56.330 --> 00:00:59.680
Sport +, which gives your vehicle
a sportier steering feel and
00:00:59.680 --> 00:01:03.660
throttle response, and is ideal for
spirited driving situations.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg5.mp4
question: What mode gives you a sportier steering feel and throttle response?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:31.040 --> 00:02:34.300
You can also input preset channels for
quick selection.
00:02:34.300 --> 00:02:37.362
To do so, tune to the channel
you wish to save, then touch and
00:02:37.362 --> 00:02:39.360
hold one of the memory preset buttons.
00:02:39.360 --> 00:02:44.420
The sound will mute for a brief moment
before resuming when the channel is saved.
00:02:44.420 --> 00:02:48.730
To add or view additional preset channels,
just touch the preset button.
00:02:48.730 --> 00:02:53.960
You can save up to 18 Sirius XM channels
with the three sets of presets.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg8.mp4

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:13.640 --> 00:01:16.560
Automatic start allows you to
test at your own pace, and
00:01:16.560 --> 00:01:18.280
begins once you hit the accelerator pedal.
00:01:20.080 --> 00:01:23.580
If you want to end the automatic start,
just hit okay on the five-way switch.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg5.mp4

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:29.790 --> 00:01:32.390
To fold your third row manual seats flat,
or
00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:36.190
tumble them to stow them in the floor,
then fold your head restraints down by
00:01:36.190 --> 00:01:39.970
pulling the strap in the middle of the
seat back, just below the head restraint.
00:01:39.970 --> 00:01:42.570
Next, fold the seat back
down by pulling and
00:01:42.570 --> 00:01:45.969
holding the number 1 strap, while
you're pushing the seat back forward.
00:01:47.330 --> 00:01:49.870
Once it starts to fold,
let go of the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg8.mp4
question: How do you fold your third row seats flat?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:02:11.050 --> 00:02:15.020
And one more thing, If you wish to
change to the conventional cruise mode,
00:02:15.020 --> 00:02:19.220
go to the menu settings on your instrument
cluster and select Cruise Control and
00:02:19.220 --> 00:02:20.110
then choose Normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg10.mp4
question: How do you change to the conventional cruise mode?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: Does the truck have a telescoping grab on safety device?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:01:06.360 --> 00:01:09.450
And if you want to adjust
your interior illumination,
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.920
meaning how bright your instrument
lights are, just press the plus or
00:01:12.920 --> 00:01:15.720
minus controls next to
the auto lamp controls.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg4.mp4
question: How do you adjust the interior illumination?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:54.288
To heat your car up and defrost
the windshield and side windows quickly,
00:01:54.288 --> 00:01:58.296
adjust the temperature control to your
desired setting or select max defrost.
00:01:58.296 --> 00:02:01.446
This will automatically turn your
air distribution to defrost,
00:02:01.446 --> 00:02:06.180
set the temperature to the hottest level
and the air flow to the maximum setting.
00:02:06.180 --> 00:02:10.650
In mild or warm temperatures you may
notice that your A/C also turns on.
00:02:10.650 --> 00:02:13.320
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg7.mp4
question: Why does the AC come on periodically when I am using the defrost?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:01:11.689 --> 00:01:15.386
When replacing the front tires,
position the head of the jack
00:01:15.386 --> 00:01:19.241
under the protrusions at the rear
of the front subframe, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg5.mp4
question: Do you place the head of the jack on the sub frame when changing a tire?

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:00:29.830 --> 00:00:33.000
Before we start,
you'll need a tape measure, some tape, and
00:00:33.000 --> 00:00:34.550
a Phillips screwdriver.
00:00:34.550 --> 00:00:37.370
And you'll want to park about
25 feet from a garage door or
00:00:37.370 --> 00:00:39.580
a wall with your headlamps aimed at it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg2.mp4
question: What tools and materials will you need before you start?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: How do I turn off Launch Control?

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:42.260 --> 00:00:43.540
And one more thing.
00:00:43.540 --> 00:00:46.130
To help protect against fuel theft,
splashing, or
00:00:46.130 --> 00:00:49.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:49.770 --> 00:00:53.241
And the self closing spring-loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:53.241 --> 00:00:56.145
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:56.145 --> 00:00:57.706
[MUSIC]
00:00:57.706 --> 00:00:58.774
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg3.mp4
question: How can you protect against fuel theft here?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: Where do you place a hoist lift?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:00:16.490 --> 00:00:20.200
To adjust the manual seat lift the bar
located in front of the seat and
00:00:20.200 --> 00:00:21.110
slide your seat forward.
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:24.650
Or backward to your desired position and
release the bar.
00:00:24.650 --> 00:00:28.130
Be sure to rock the seat a little to
make sure it's locked into place.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg2.mp4
question: Can you only adjust the seat in one direction?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg4.mp4
question: Does mild acceleration or braking affects the amount of energy being used while driving?

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:47.300 --> 00:00:51.375
Using the five way switch on your steering
wheel, from the settings menu, scroll to
00:00:51.375 --> 00:00:56.910
pre-collision, alert sensitivity, and
then select high, normal, or low.
00:00:56.910 --> 00:01:01.280
A lower setting will send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting with give earlier,
00:01:01.280 --> 00:01:02.250
more frequent warnings.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg3.mp4

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:47.300 --> 00:00:51.375
Using the five way switch on your steering
wheel, from the settings menu, scroll to
00:00:51.375 --> 00:00:56.910
pre-collision, alert sensitivity, and
then select high, normal, or low.
00:00:56.910 --> 00:01:01.280
A lower setting will send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting with give earlier,
00:01:01.280 --> 00:01:02.250
more frequent warnings.

video_trans:

lights to stay on that long,
00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260
you could always change the duration.
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:55.306
Just go to the message center,
scroll to Settings, Lightning and
00:00:55.306 --> 00:00:56.687
then Autolamp Delay.
00:00:56.687 --> 00:01:00.422
Here you can select the length of

cluster and hear an audible alert.

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:13.370 --> 00:00:15.540
Once you've input
the correct measurements and
00:00:15.540 --> 00:00:18.270
placed the sticker as explained
in the how to set up video.
00:00:19.570 --> 00:00:21.130
When you shift into reverse,
00:00:21.130 --> 00:00:25.170
press the Camera button to expand
the menu options on the display screen.
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:28.420
Then press the Trailer icon and
select the trailer you want.
00:00:28.420 --> 00:00:34.030
You will then see the camera view on
the side where your trailer is moving,
00:00:34.030 --> 00:00:36.300
or both sides when the trailer
is directly behind you.
00:00:37.360 --> 00:00:41.960
Auto mode, which is the default mode,
changes views with the trailer direction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg2.mp4
question: How I turn on the trailer camera?

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:04.630 --> 00:00:07.470
Did you know that there are a few
things you can do to maximize
00:00:07.470 --> 00:00:10.140
the electric range of your
plug in hybrid vehicle?
00:00:10.140 --> 00:00:13.560
As with any vehicle, there are some
basic rules you can follow.
00:00:13.560 --> 00:00:14.980
Let me explain.
00:00:14.980 --> 00:00:18.350
For starters, make sure to keep
your tires properly inflated,
00:00:18.350 --> 00:00:22.610
accelerate gradually from a stop,
brake smoothly, use heat and
00:00:22.610 --> 00:00:26.130
air conditioning moderately,
and maintain the speed limit.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg1.mp4
question: What are a few things that you can do to maximize the range of your electric hybrid vehicle?

video_name: Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0
video_trans:
00:00:47.945 --> 00:00:52.325
For added convenience, there's also a LED
cargo light to help illuminate the rear
00:00:52.325 --> 00:00:54.570
area when hitching a trailer at night.
00:00:54.570 --> 00:00:58.196
Just press the button located to
the left of the headlamp control, here,
00:00:58.196 --> 00:00:58.906
to turn it on.
00:00:58.906 --> 00:01:03.220
Or the light button located
in the rear box, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0_seg4.mp4
